loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Daakyi Nti Group

texts.en:
Kwadwo is fifty-five years old. He is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school. He works hard to provide for his family. Kwadwo is the leader of a trust bank group called "Daakyi Nti," which means "for the future." In the photograph, the group leader, Kwadwo, is standing.

The members of the group are engaged in commercial activities such as food vending, clothes selling, etc. Some of them hawk (go door-to-door) to sell their products while others trek to nearby communities to sell on their market days. They buy the goods in Kumasi and nearby towns. The experience that some of these traders have amassed over the years has given them the urge to expand their businesses. Thus, they need a loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna P., age 62, is from the village of Taguilon. Luna is married and has 10 grown children. To make a living, Luna owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Luna is just starting this business.

In 2007, Luna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Luna has successfully repaid her last loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Luna is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Luna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Tu use as working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora GUILLERMINA G. S. , tiene 72 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo , departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL PROGRESO.
La empresaria es analfabeta; refiere que es de Salpo (sierra Liberteña) y desde pequeña se dedico al campo y cuidado de los animales.
Proviene de una familia muy humilde motivo por el cual tuvo que trabajar desde los 5 años de edad y sus padres no le dieron educación.
La socia es casada  y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores, quienes la apoyan económicamente y también la ayudan cuando se encuentra enferma. 

GULLERMINA se dedica a  la venta de productos alimenticios en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.
Compra los productos al por mayor como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, verduras, golosinas, gaseosas, cerveza, etc.

El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos alimenticios la por mayor para así poder obtener mayores ganancias.
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra de mas productos alimenticios al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite; así como también comprará vitrinas y andamios que necesita para su tienda.
LA Empresaria sueña con aumentar sus productos y poder así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora GUILLERMINA G. S. is 72 years old and lives in the Trujillo district of Trujillo province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank MUJERES AL PROGRESO. This businesswoman is illiterate. She recounts that she is from Salpo (Liberteña mountains), and ever since she was young she has worked in the countryside caring for animals. She comes from a family of very humble circumstances, and for this reason she had to work since she was 5 years old so her parents were not able to give her an education. She is married, and has 4 grown children who provide her with some economic support and also help her when she is ill. Guillermina is engaged in the business of selling food products in a grocery store that she has in her house. She buys products wholesale such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, vegetables, candy, soft drinks, beer, etc. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was invested in the purchase of wholesale food products so that she could obtain better earnings. This loan of 800 nuevos soles will be used to purchase more wholesale food products such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, as well as to purchase glass display cases and new shelving that she needs for her store. She dreams of increasing her products and thereby increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products such as rice, sugar, noodles and cooking oil, and also to buy glass display cases and shelving

loans.name: Simon Musyoka

texts.en:
Simon is a 32-year-old single man. His primary business is photography. He also has a grocery shop in Kayole where most of his clients are. He has been in the business for a period of four years and has been getting a profit of approximately 12,000 Kenya shillings a month.

He was introduced to KADET by a member of his borrower group. He has never borrowed from another MFI and this is his first loan with KADET. With it, he plans to buy a stock of groceries for his shop in order to increase his profit and improve his living standards. He hopes to expand his business by opening new outlets in different areas. 

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries for his secondary business

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat is a hard-working entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and is the happy father of three children. He owns a market vending business located in a busy locale where he sells men's clothing. Nemat decided to start his own business after he was unable to find other work. In addition to his business, he also works part time as a taxi driver, which enables him to supplement his income.

Nemat has requested a loan of 5,000 Somoni. He plans to purchase new inventory for his business. Nemat will use the expected profits from his business to improve his standard of living and to do some remodeling to his home.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new goods for sale.

loans.name: Vao

texts.en: Vao M. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Falealupo Uta. She is married and has six adult children. Vao owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. In 2008, Vao joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Vao is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: El Porvenir Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “EL PORVENIR“se encuentra en su 4º Ciclo, consta D. 12 mujeres. Todas viven en el Barrio tienen diferentes negocios, L. reunión se lleva a cabo en L. casa D. L. Presidenta Sra. Mairene. Los Negocios D. las socias son diversos por ejemplo Sra. Mairene tiene una venta D. comida en su hogar, L. Sra. Maribel vive al lado D. L. casa D. reunión y tiene una pensión, otra señora venD. empanadas, refresco, otras venden comida, también venden ropa y cosméticos. Las socias mencionan que existe gran cantidad D. competencia en relación a este crédito pero ellas hacen L. diferencia que Agrocapital trabaja D. manera transparente, y le da muchas ventajas y accesibilidad a este crédito. Generalmente las socias indican que el crédito lo sacan para sus negocios, para aumentar su capital, asimismo puedan crecer con sus negocios. En su mayoría tienen experiencia en Banca Comunal ya que trabajaban en otras entidades financieras. Sus antecedentes crediticios son buenos y cumplen con los requerimientos D. L. Institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “EL PORVENIR“ is on their 4th loan cycle and consists of 12 women. They all live in the Barrio and have different businesses. They meet in the house of President Mrs. Mairene. The businesses of the members are diverse. For example, Mrs. Mairene sells food in her home. Mrs. Maribel lives next door to the house where the meetings are held and she receives a pension. Another woman sells empanadas and drinks while others sell food as well as clothes and cosmetics. The members mention that there is a lot of competition to get this loan, but they make a difference in that Kiva partner Agrocapital works transparently, and provides advantages and access to this credit. Generally, the members say that the loan they are taking out is for their businesses and to increase their capital. This way, they can grow their businesses. The majority of the members have experience with communal banking since they worked in other financial institutions. They have good credit history and comply with the requirements of the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Rafael G. Calonge posee un comercio de venta de teléfonos celulares, accesorios, activación de lineas de celulares y reparación de celulares. 

Su comercio posee 5 años de antigüedad, clientela formada y muy buena venta.

El cliente es soltero, tiene 30 años, no tiene hijos es oriundo de 

Nueva Londres pero hace 8 años reside en la cuidad de Encarnación.

Vive en alquiler y sera relocalizado por la Entidad Binacional

Yacyreta tanto con un local comercial como con una vivienda.
texts.en:
Jorge Rafael G. Calonge owns a business that sells cellular telephones and accessories, activates cellular phone lines, and repairs cell phones. He has owned this business for five years, has formed a clientele, and has very good sales. Jorge is single, is 30 years old, and does not have children. He is a native of Nueva Londres but has lived in the city of Encarnación for eight years. He lives in a rental and will relocate to Entidad Binacional Yacyreta to a place that will serve as a locale for his business as well as a home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (working capital)

loans.name: Yaok

texts.en:
Yaok K., 29, is a widow who lives with two of her children in Takeo province. She is a professional tailor who works for US$5 a day.

Yaok K. typically spends around US$30 on food, US$5 on utilities and US$10 on other expense. To earn more money, she is asking for a loan of US$250 to purchase more fabric to make more clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric

loans.name: Greisy Pierina

texts.es:
Greisy Pierina, es una mujer jovial, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 20 años, ella se dedica a la repostería, esta actividad la realiza en su casa  de donde posteriormente efectúa la entrega de pedidos a domicilio, es soltera. 
Greisy Pierina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las triunfadoras”, desde hace 2 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en  la compra de implementos para repostería, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 700 soles para la compra de accesorios de repostería como son: piletas, armazones, muñecas. La meta de Greisy es ampliar su negocio y tener su microempresa de pasteles y tortas.
texts.en:
Greisy Pierina is a cheerful woman who lives in the Calleria district of the Ucayali Region. She is 20 years old and single. Her work is making cakes, which she prepares at her own house and then delivers to her customers' homes. Greisy Pierina has been a member of the "Las Triunfadoras” ("The Winners") communal bank for the past two years. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in accessories for cake making. She now needs a loan of 700 soles to purchase cake-making accessories such as pans, frames and figurines. Greisy's goal is to expand her business and operate a microenterprise making various kinds of cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing accessories for cake making such as pans, frames and figurines

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El señor Hilario M. es una persona muy trabajadora es empleado de una fabrica en el aria de producción, también se dedica a la construcción los fines de semana.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar herramienta que necesita para realizar sus trabajos de construcción. 
Ya que son los ingresos que tiene para el y su esposa quienes viven solos, porque sus hijos ya tiene su propia familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de sus trabajos de construcción.
texts.en:
Hilario is a very hard worker. He works in a factory in an industrial area and also works construction on the weekends. He is asking for this loan in order to buy some tools that he needs for his construction work. The income he earns is for him and his wife, because his children have their own families. He will repay this loan from the income her receives from his construction work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Tashanova Umsun's Group

texts.ru:
Это история пришла к вам из маленького села расположенного на границе двух стран: Кыргызстан и Узбекистан. В наши сложные времена несколько человек решили объединить свои усилия для поддержки друг друга, с целью улучшения своей жизни и создания новых возможностей. Они получают кредит в МБФ уже в третий раз, показали себя отличными заемщиками и хорошими людьми. 

Начнем презентацию членов группы, как обычно с лидера, человека собравшего всех вместе. 

Умсун 50 лет, замужем и воспитывает 2 детей: сына и дочьку. Сын учится в выпускном классе средней школы, а дочь уже студентка первого курса факультета иностранных языков. Ее супруг работает ветеринарным врачом в сельской управе. Сама же преподает кыргызский язык в местной школе. Кроме этого семья клиента занимается разведением скота, посевом сельхоз угодий, а также розничной реализацией товаров народного потребления с домашнего магазина. Кредит будет использован для закупа одного теленка-бычка для последужющего выращивания. 

Майрамкан 47 лет, мать двоих детей. У них достаточно большой семейный бизнес, который включает животноводство и птицеводство, а также производство молока и молочных продуктов. Этим бизнесом они начали заниматься с 1990 года. В данное время у них есть 3 дойных коровы, 1 лошадь, 50 кур, 15 овец. На этот кредит они планируют купить сено и корма для живности. 

Мурзаева Фариде 25 лет. Она проживает с матерью-пенсионеркой, братом и сестрой. Два старших члена семьи находятся на заработказ в РФ. Ежемесячно отсылают минимум 300 долларов. Они занимаются выращиванием сельхоз культур. В год получают по два урожая. Первым планируют посеить картофель, а на второй посеить кукурузу и подсолнух. Кредит будет использован для оплаты услуг тракториста, а также закуп пару овец для выращивания. 

Лолахон, 43, вдова. В одиночестве воспитывает одного 13 летнего сына. Ее мечта дать ему возможность получить хорощее образование. Она работает бухгалтером в Гулбаарской сельской управе. Кредит будет использован для закупа строительных материалов (цемент, известь). 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
This story comes to you from a small village located on the border of two countries: Kyrgyztan and Uzbekistan. During these difficult times several people have decided to come together for each other's support with one goal to make their lives better and to create new possibilities. They are receiving a loan at MCC MBF for the third time and have shown to be outstanding borrowers and good people. Let's begin the introduction of the group members starting with the leader, as usual, who has brought everyone together. Umsun is 50 years old, she is married and is raising two children - a son and a daughter. Her son is finishing his senior year in the secondary school, and her daughter is already a first year student in college majoring in foreign languages. Her husband works as a veterinarian in the village board. She is a Kyrgyz language teacher in the local school. Besides everything her family has a cattle breeding business, a vegetable sowing business and also a retail business selling household products and other goods from their home store. The loan will be used to buy a calf for growing. Mayramkan is 47 years old, she is a mother of two children. They have a very large family business which includes animal husbandry and bird breeding, as well as production of milk and milk products. They started this business in 1990. At this time they have three milk cows, one horse, 50 chickens and fifteen sheep. They plan to use this loan to buy hay stock and fodder for the livestock. Farida M. is 25 years old. She lives with her senior mother, brother and sister. Two older family members and now working in the Russian Federation. They send at least $300 every month. They are in agriculture and collect the harvest twice a year. For the first one they plan to sow potatoes and for the second one corn and sunflowers. The loan will be used to pay for the tractor services and to buy a couple of sheep for growing. Lolahon is 43, she is a widow. She is raising a thirteen year old son by herself. Her dream is to give him the opportunity to get good education. She works as an accountant in the Gulbaar local board. The loan will be used to buy building materials (e.g. cement, limestone).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one calf, hay, fodder, building materials

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda C. is from the town of Balibago 1st, Tarlac. She is 42 years old. Imelda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business providing welding services to local community members. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda B. is from the village of Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Emelda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emelda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Emelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Emelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Emelda from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 02.03.011-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hong N. T. (5) is a 57 year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.03.011-Hoang Hoa (02.03.011 Hoang Hoa).

Hong is married and has three adult children. To making a living, she raises cattle for sale and has done so for over 10 years earning approximately 600.000 VND a month.

In 2003, Hong joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 2.442.600 VND which will also be used to purchase baby livestock. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Hong from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  C. T. Hang (61) is a 50 year-old woman who is requesting a 3.079.800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2.  N. T. Diem (37) is a 27 year-old woman who is requesting a 2.442.600 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3.  C. T. Loi (54) is a 56 year-old female who is requesting a 2.442.600 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4.  C. T. Lieu (71) is a 32 year-old woman who is requesting a 2.442.600 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hong N. T. (5) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Hong là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.03.011-Hoang Hoa (02.03.011 Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Hong thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hong kiếm được khoảng 600.000 VND.  Vào 2003, Hong đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hong đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 2.442.600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  C. T. Hang (61) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Diem (37) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.442.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  C. T. Loi (54) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.442.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  C. T. Lieu (71) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.442.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Solidario Mil Flores Group

texts.es:
El grupo Solidario Mil Flores está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas provenientes de Pochocuape, comarca rural de Managua. Este lugar cuenta con precarias condiciones de acceso donde su ingreso se da solo por caponeras y con las lluvias se ha deteriorado notablemente la vía de transito.

La coordinadora del grupo es  Gioconda del Carmen A. Zabala quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y ropa desde hace tres años. Ella inició con este negocio con el fin de contar  con mayores ingresos en el hogar y sacar adelante a sus dos hijos junto con su esposo Ernesto Antonio Zelaya policía de tránsito.
A. invertirá en perfumes, cremas new, cremas rejuvenecedoras, colonias noir, camisas de damas y pantalones que son los productos donde tiene mayor demanda.

Sus compañeras de grupo son  Claudia Marcela A. T.  quien en 1998 inicio a realizar comales,  pailas, cazuelas etc. y Sonia del Carmen T. Z. quien tiene un pequeña venta y kiosco en el colegio Rey David quien invertirá en tajadas, mentas, gaseosas, bombones, meneítos, bananos, jocote etc.
texts.en:
The support group Mil Flores is made up of three hard working, dedicated and decisive women from Pochocuape, a rural area of Managua. The area has precarious access conditions and can only be reached by motorcycle taxi. With the rains, the road has deteriorated notably. The group coordinator is Gioconda del Carmen A. Zabala, who has sold cosmetics and clothing for three years. She began this business with the purpose of having more income and getting ahead with her two children and her husband Ernesto Antonio Zelaya, who is a traffic police officer. A. will invest in perfume, New cream, Noir cologne, revitalizing creams, and women's shirts and pants. These are her products that have the highest demand. The other group members are Claudia Marcela A. T., who in 1998 began making griddles, buckets, pots, etc., and Sonia del Carmen T. Z. who has a small kiosk in the Rey David high school. She will invest in baked goods, mints, sodas, candies, chips, bananas, jocote fruit, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In the purchase of perfumes, New cream, Noir cologne, revitalizing creams, and women's shirts and pants.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 48 years old. Norma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business venture into agriculture sector managing a hog raising business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising hogs for sale. Norma has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Norma is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase hog feeds and supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds and supplies

loans.name: Richar Jesus

texts.es:
Richar G. P. es un joven con mucha fuerza de trabajo, que todo lo ha conseguido con su buen comportamiento, disciplina y autocontrol; como buen Santandereano , a su edad es ya propietario de una Tienda de Abastos, vive con su padre y sus hermanas de 13 a 23 años ; llegó a la Costa Caribe buscando mejores oportunidades e inició trabajando en una panadería y cuando aprendió  quiso independizarse, por lo que el dueño de este negocio,  viendo su gran responsabilidad le presto los primeros $200.000 COP y posteriormente $10.000.000 COP asì fuè como se trajo a su papa de Norte de Santander y empezaron a trabajar en su propia tienda después de la enfermedad de su madre ya fallecida; en la actualidad  cada uno atiende su negocio.
Este es su segundo crédito con La Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el primero pudo bajar muchas de sus deudas, pero gracias a Dios hoy todo se ha normalizado;  además con esta inyección de capital de trabajo logró comprar de contado a los proveedores, lo cual  le garantizó mejores precios para competir en el mercado. Esta es la razón por la que  Richar está aplicando  por un crédito de $1.800.000 COP,  él quiere comprar de contado la mayor parte de sus mercancías: arroz, azúcar, café, aceite, enlatados, refrescos y bebidas.
Su sueño más adelante es tener su casa propia, apoyar a su familia y sacar tiempo para estudiar y seguir preparándose, pero lo que más añora es buscar espacios de diversión y esparcimiento porque en la actualidad solo vive trabajando.
texts.en:
Richar G. P. is a young man with a strong work ethic; everything he’s accomplished has been due to his good behavior, discipline and self-control. As a good citizen of Santander, at his young age he already owns a grocery store. He lives with his father and sisters who are 13 and 23 years of age. He came to the Caribbean coast region looking for better opportunities and started working in a bakery. Having learned those skills, he sought to become independent. The owner of the bakery, recognizing Richar’s sense of responsibility, lent him the initial $200.000 pesos and later an additional $10.000.000 pesos. This is how he was able to bring his father from north Santander and they began to work in their own store after the illness and death of his mother. Currently, each tends to his business. This is his 2nd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He used the first one to pay down several of his debts; thanks to God everything has normalized now. With this capital input he was able to pay cash to his suppliers which guaranteed lower prices and allowed him to be competitive in the marketplace. This is why Richar is now applying for a $1.800.000 pesos loan; he wants to pay cash for most of his merchandise like: rice, coffee, cooking oil, canned goods, beverages and soft-drinks. His future dream includes owning his own home, helping out his family, and carving out some free time to go to school to continue preparing himself. However, what he would most like is to find ways to relax and enjoy himself because currently all he does is work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay cash for most of his stock merchandise.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita M. is a 44-year old married woman who supports her family by operating "buy and sell" ( Bananaque ) and fruits vending businesses. She lives in Prk. Tubod, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP2,500.  

Paulita is now borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy more stocks for her "buy and sell" business.  This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Paulita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 
 
--------------------------------
About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
"

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel T. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 26 years old, married and has a 6-year-old child. Ritchel owns and operates a farm. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also runs a sari-sari store located at their house. Ritchel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. 

Ritchel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Ritchel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ritchel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ritchel from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma B. is from the village of Bandera. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame M. is married and has four children. She has no educational background.  Maame operates a provisions shop at Takoradi. With the help of her husband she is able to take good care of her children. Maame will add the loan to her original money to purchase more provisions that consumers have been requesting.  She anticipates using the new revenue she is hopeful of generating to open another shop at a different locality.

loans.use: purchase more provisions that consumers have been requesting

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza A. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 34 years old. Analiza is married and has 3 school-aged children. She is a farmer, just like her husband. They both till their land to plant rice crops. Her husband is also a driver. He uses his motorcycle to transport people around their community. Analiza wants to have a happy family and she does her best to fulfill her obligations.

Analiza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Analiza from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ilyosjon

texts.en: M. Ilyosjon is 37 years old and is married with four children. He is a manufacturer, producing wooden doors and window frames. His shop is located right in his house. Working in this business for twelve years, he become rather experienced and now he has some students. Producing goods of good quality and acceptable prices, Ilyosjon has many customers. In general his business is very successful and generates a stable income for the family. Now Ilyosjon is planning to purchase an additional woodworking machine required for expansion of his business. With this purpose in mind, he requests $1,500. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase an additional woodworking machine

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 22 years old and is still single. He is well-known in the business of selling dishes and some other domestic items. He has been in this business for about six years and his business hours are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Fabien needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his business through purchasing different kinds of dishes and some additional domestic items. If successful, he will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition, he will create some other sources of income, providing jobs for people in his community.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods such as dishes and some additional domestic items

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, age 39, is married to Peter Obiere who is also in business.They live in Njiru, a Nairobi suburb. Esther operates a hardware shop in Njiru, which is fairly urban--most of her clients are low-income earners in Njiru. She has done this for the last three years. With this loan, she plans to buy cement and other items for the shop. She has borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and open other outlets.

loans.use: Esther plans to buy cement for Kshs 50,000, and other stock items for Kshs 10,000.

loans.name: Jihan

texts.en: Jihan is a 34-year-old married woman who has been working as a makeup artist since 2009. She has 15 years of experience. Jihan owns a beauty salon and is a hard worker. She helps her husband with many things because she believes that marriage is based on sharing and commitment. Jihan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to improve her business, pay what’s left from her car’s price and keep extra cash with her for hospital expenses, since she’s going to give birth to a beautiful baby soon. Jihan is very optimistic and supportive. She hopes to expand her business to a famous beauty institute soon. Her clients like her work a lot. Most of them are relatives, friends, neighbors and friends of friends.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Seyidaga

texts.ru:
Seyidaga A. 27 let. On ne jenat i uje qod kak vmeste s semyoy oni pereyaxali v Absehron region.
Seyidaga uje qod kak rabotayet taksistom, iz za toqo chto oni pereyexali on bil vinujden pomenyat svoyu rabotu , no po slovam Seyidaga on etu novuyu rabotu taksista polubil yeshe bolshe chem staruyu rabotu.

Eto uje vtoroya ssuda Seyidagi , v perviy raz on bral 725$ on ochen blagodaren lenderam za ssudu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyeqo taksi.


http://partners.kiva.org/lend/35749
texts.en: Seyidaga A. is 27 years old.  He is not married and moved to the Absheron region together with his family one year ago.  Seyidaga has been working as a taxi driver for one year.  Due to the move, he had to change jobs, but, according to his own words, Sayidaga loves this new taxi driving work more than his old job.  This is Seyidaga's second loan.  He first borrowed $725 and is very grateful to the lenders for the credit.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy parts for his taxi.

loans.use: Purchase of parts for the car

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto B. is from the village of Cebunig, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 27 years old. Loreto is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Loreto owns & operates a service-based services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Loreto has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Loreto joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair existing vehicle for better service. Loreto is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the second loan taken out by Loreto from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Sebastian, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Alejandro; el tiene 54 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio se dedica al negocio de carpintería, el tiene un taller donde fabrica diferentes muebles como camas,mesas,sillas y ventanas, el socio trabaja juntamente con su esposa y sus hijos, todos ellos realizan trabajos en madera y luego los llevan a vender a lugares como Quillabamba y Sicuani y aquí en la ciudad de Cusco lo vende en el centro comercial el Molino, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de taller de carpintería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera y materiales para fabricar los muebles.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, construcción, carpintería, transporte y tienda de abarrotes.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN” communal bank which is located in San Sebastián district in Cusco province, Cusco department.

Alejandro, 54, is married and has 5 children.  He is a carpenter and has a shop where he makes different kinds of furniture like: beds, chairs and windows.  He works with his wife and children.  They all make wood items that they then go out to sell in places like Quillabamba, Sicuani and here in the city of Cusco at the El Molino Shopping Center.  He works from 6am until 10pm.  He wants to expand his carpentry shop and is asking for a loan to buy wood and other furniture making supplies.

The other members sell second hand clothes, are in construction, carpentry, transport and grocery sales.

He is grateful to all who share in his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy wood and other furniture making supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca de 37 años de edad, se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura vive con sus hijos y su esposo, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, ella junto a su esposo desarrolla lo que es la agricultura y atender al ganado ya que es un trabajo fuerte para desarrollarlo una mujer.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para compra de abono para la siembra de maíz, este préstamo le facilitara la obtención de lo necesario para realizar la siembra.
Blanca espera realzar un buen cultivo y recoger buena cosecha para dar alimentación a su familia y continuar trabajando con su esposo por el bienestar del hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca id 37 years old.  She farms livestock and crops.  She lives with her husband and children in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  Together with her husband she farms her crops and looks after her livestock since it is difficult work for a woman.

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy manure for her corn crops.  She will use the loan to buy what she needs in order to sow her crops.  She hopes that her crops will grow well and that she will have a good harvest so that she can feed her family and continue working with her husband for the well-being of her household.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers so that she can sow her corn

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 38 years old and single.  He earns a living from dairy farming. It’s been four years since he started the business. He has managed to employ one person in his business.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his finances. This has helped him to develop his business. He hopes to add more cows to his farm. 

He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy animal feeds and to provide veterinary check-ups for the cows.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and provide a veterinary check-up for his cows

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
La señora María Aida Vázquez Gómez, vive en la Ribera General Sandino, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera con dos hijos  que está a su responsabilidad y son: Rodrigo Ignacio de trece años y  la más pequeña es Yuliana Montserrat de cinco años de edad.

        El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá para comprar mercancía y surtir su tienda de abarrotes  en    la cual  aun  inicio  hace  unos meses  y le está dando buen resultado cuando menos para sostener a sus dos hijos.

        Inicio por su propio merito ya que para trabajar sus pequeños ahorros tenía que emprender  una actividad de 
la cual  ella pueda salir adelante con su  familia que es muy importante para ella.
 
        De las ganancia que tiene lo invierte en la compra de mas mercancía  que le hacen falta en su pequeño negocio  así día con día se valla incrementado mas.

        De sea que su tiendita de abarrotes pueda ampliarse  y con ellos lograr todos sus sueño, como lograr ahorrar para comprar materiales y construir su casa que es lo que más desea tener.

       Su grupo se llama el arbolito, la razón del nombre es porque en frente de su casa hay un arbolito de ciprés. Formo parte del grupo por una invitación que le izo su prima la señora Guadalupe.

      Las personas que forman el grupo son  de  tres señoras y cada una  con su respectiva actividad:

     Guadalupe G. F.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de pollos por reja para luego venderlo en la misma región.

    María Aida Vázquez Gómez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes comprando: azúcar, frijol, aceite, galletas, entre otros.

     Verónica del Carmen Z. Gómez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de pollos por reja para luego venderlo aliñado  en la comunidad.
texts.en:
María Aida Vázquez Gómez lives in General Sandono, a riverside settlement in the Copainala municipality of the state of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is single, and she has two children she is responsible for.  Rodrigo Ignacio is 13 years old, and the younger child is 5 year old Yuliana Montserrat.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.  She just started it a few months ago.  It is giving her good results, at least with supporting her two children.  She started through her own merit.  To put her small savings to work, she had to undertake a business activity that would allow her to get her family ahead.  This is very important to her.

She uses the earnings that she gets to buy more merchandise that her small business needs.  That way, day by day, the business is increasing.  She wants to be able to expand her grocery store.  She wants to fulfill all of her dreams like saving to buy materials and building her house, which is what she most wishes to have.

Her group is called “Arbolito” (Little Tree) because there is a small cypress tree in front of her house.  She joined the group by invitation from her cousin, Guadalupe.

The group is comprised of three women.  Each one has their respective business activity.

Guadalupe G. F.: Will use the loan to buy live chickens which she will then sell in the area.

María Aida Vázquez Gómez: Will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.  She will buy sugar, beans, oil, cookies, and other things.

Verónica del Carmen Z. Gómez: Will use the loan to buy live chickens.  She will later sell dressed chicken in her community.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like sugar, beans, oil, rice, and other products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Silvia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene una niña de cinco años que este año recién va a primer año de educación básica. Su esposo trabaja en una camaronera.

Ella es una consultora de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja cinco días a la semana unas cinco horas al dia, nos cuenta que ella tiene a su cargo a otras vendedoras a quienes tiene que tomarles sus pedidos y luego entregarles los mismos, pero también realiza sus ventas personales las cuales  deja  a crédito y cobra en dos partes una al inicio y otra a los quince días. Sus productos los recibe en su casa, nos cuenta que lo mas vende son los perfumes y los cosméticos y que lleva  tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Su sueño es ser directora de Yanbal ya que ellas obtienen grandes beneficios.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto the communal bank Virgen De Guadalupe meets every fifteen days. This area is known for its traditional culture and also for being just a couple of minutes from the best beaches in the province such as San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Silvia is the founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because interest rates are lower than in other loan institutions and because of the ease of the loans. Silvia is 27 years old, is in a civil union relationship and she and her partner have a five year old daughter who this year is going to her first year of elementary school. Her partner works in the shrimp industry.

Silvia is a consultant of Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and woman's accessories). She works five days a week, five hours a day. She tells us that she is in charge of other vendors who take her orders and then deliver them, but she also makes her own sales which she does on credit and charges in two parts, one initially and the other fifteen days later. She receives her products in her house and she tells us she mostly sells perfumes and cosmetics and that she has been in this business for three years and that it has gone very well. 
 
This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products. Her dream is to be a director of Yanbal since they get great benefits.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío La Estancia ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial, conocida como la capital del limón a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de tres años, él siembra maracuyá y limón en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

 Elio desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento de plantación a su cultivo de maracuyá, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Elio es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elio is 35 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the village of La Estancia in the District of Olmos. This farming district experiences significant commercial activity and is known as the “the lemon capital”. The community is more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Elio has worked in farm-related activities for more than three years. He grows passion fruit and lemons on a small plot of land that he owns. Throughout this time, he has learned a great deal about managing his crops. The revenue he generates from his farming activities is used to cover his family’s daily needs.

Elio wants to acquire fertilizers so that he can maintain his passion fruit crop. By taking this action, he hopes to achieve a good harvest. For this reason, he has found it necessary to request a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Elio is a peaceful and responsible individual. His greatest wish is to grow as an entrepreneur and move forward.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for his passion fruit crop

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Heang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan contains nine members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so it can improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Koem Heang is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow both rice and vegetables for selling to earn some money to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Then, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they can only earn a little income.

In order to improve this situation, she wants to start anew, but her savings are not enough to support this. Thus, Mrs. Koem Heang is asking for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding. She is the mother of three children who are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes L. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 38 years old. Ma. Lourdes is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Lourdes owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling vegetables like squash and Chinese pechay (cabbage) and also selling spices and food seasonings in the local community. Ma. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ma. Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Lourdes is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables like eggplant and carrots. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables like eggplant and carrots

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 5 years.  Dinah also earns additional income by selling salt in the market.

Dinah is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy textile and other supplies for her tailoring business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  

Dinah dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and other supplies for her tailoring business

loans.name: Mr. Heang Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fifteen people. Each member’s portion of the loan will be used for different purposes in order to improve their own family's standard of living. Mr. Heang is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He was born in 1965. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to support his own family and he is a village chief. His wife is a pig breeder and a weaver. Since his wife’s business is going well, he wants it to expand. So, Mr. Heang is seeking a loan to buy more silk. He is the father of two children. They are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Erick

texts.es: Erick es un joven emprendedor, tiene 24 años, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 1 año decidió tener su propia fuente de ingresos y es así que emprendió en la venta de prendas de vestir en las ferias comerciales. El tipo de prenda que ofrece va de acuerdo a la temporada, y cuando le hace falta más mercadería se va a la ciudad de Lima para conseguir el tipo de ropa que el cliente previamente le ha pedido. Sin embargo existe mucha competencia en su zona, pero ha logrado salir adelante. Una de la ventaja de su negocio es que ofrece  descuentos y ofertas, de esa manera ha logrado mantener a su clientela. Por ello anhela progresar en su negocio. Es su crédito número 5 con MFP, significa mucho para ser parte de un banco comunal porque le da un respaldo que necesita para crecer en su negocio y se compromete una vez más a seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería de temporada y de esa manera aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Erick is an enterprising young man. He is 24 years old, single, and lives at home with his parents. More than a year ago, he decided that he wanted his own source of income. Therefore, he started selling clothes at the commercial fairs. The type of clothes he sells depends on the season. When he runs low on merchandise, he goes to the city of Lima to acquire the types of clothes his customers have previously requested. There is much competition in the area, but he has managed to succeed. The advantages of Erick’s business include the discounts and specials he offers. This strategy has helped him maintain his clientele. He hopes to make progress in his business.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Being part of his Communal Bank has significant meaning to Erick because he receives the support he needs to grow his business. He promises to continue submitting his payments on time. With this loan, Erick will invest in the purchase of more season merchandise so that he can increase his operating capital.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aida; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de gas y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y leche y también la socia vende cerveza desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de gas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de tiendas de abarrotes y para comprar gas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Aida is a member of the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" ("Working Mothers") communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco. 

She is 43 years old, single with 2 children. On top of her daily activities she has a gas selling business and also runs a grocery store selling staples such as rice, sugar, noodles and milk as well as beer. She sells from  5:00 am to 7:00 pm, She would like to expand and improve her grocery store and the gas selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy groceries and gas.

She is happy with the loan and committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: to buy groceries and gas.

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.ru:
Bakhtiyar 47 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione v poselke Makhmudlu vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi.
Uje 5 let kak Bakhtiyar zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta kotorogo on prodayet v magazini. On izgotavlivayet yogurt i kefir dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyar is 47 years old. He is married and has two children, both in school. He is an Internally displaced person from the town of Fuzuli, now living in the Fuzuli Region in the village of Makhmudlu, together with his wife and children.

For the last five years, Bakhtiyar has been working in animal farming. He raises cattle. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy more cows to increase the production of milk, which he sells to stores. He also makes yogurt and kefir for sale.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 27-year-old businessman.  He is single and has no children. In 2003, he established his used Africana clothing and slipper business. He began his business because he wanted to generate income for his livelihood and prepare himself for starting his own family.  Working six days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. He requires a loan in order to purchase more Africana clothing and slippers for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, he plans to construct a building and start his own family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more Africana cloth for his business.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha’s inspiration for getting into the apartment business was her children and the knowledge that she was not meant to work for someone else her whole life. She chose to become a landlord because she felt that she could own this business, work full-time until it took a foothold, and still devote time to her three children. 

Bertha realized she wanted to own rental property while sitting on the porch of her rented apartment in Houston, Texas. As she looked at the ugly façade of her complex, she began to visualize the numerous ways in which the building could be improved. After a short time, she says, she had a crystal clear idea of how to turn the run-down complex into a beautiful, flourishing community.

With this dream as her motivation, Bertha decided to take a courageous leap. With only her experience as a renter as her guide, she called her landlord to discuss purchasing the complex. Six months later, Bertha was the owner of Bertha’s Homes and landlord of a newly purchased community of apartments. The first thing she attended to, she says, were the immediate, smaller repairs needed on the five units in her complex. Now, she is beginning to hire companies to repair the larger, structural issues with the building such as the weak foundations and old windows.

Raising a family, learning the ins and outs of a new business, and working a full-time job hasn’t been easy. Bertha has had to grapple with a system of building permits and city officials, which, at one point, threatened to condemn her buildings and bankrupt her business. She says that her biggest business success to date was convincing the city that she would make the needed repairs to bring the buildings up to code. 

With this loan, Bertha will pay for the repairs to the major structural problems with her building. Without it, she says, she would have lost her business because, though she had enough saved for the minor repairs, she could not afford to pay the companies she hired to do the larger, most necessary ones.

Though she says that every cent from her day job as a cook at a restaurant turns into a new investment in her business, Bertha remains satisfied and happy with her decision to become a landlord. She advises others to not get discouraged and to keep on trying until you have reached your goals. Getting started is the most difficult part, she says, and “if a door doesn’t open, it is because it’s not the one that will lead you to success. That’s the way I look at it.”

loans.use: to pay for major structural repairs to her 5-unit apartment building.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urquillos en la Provincia de Calca y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ceferina; la socia tiene 56 años de edad, la socia es casada; La socia tiene 5 hijos; la socia se dedica a la agricultura como actividad principal, y al comercio minorista, la socia compra y venta de verduras; ella vende todo tipo de verduras como zapallo, tomate, brócoli, coliflor, habas, arvejas, zanahoria, cebollas, lechuga; pero su principal actividad es la agricultura, la socia vende al por mayor maíz blanco y amarillo, cuando está fresco vende choclo y cuando está maduro y termina de secar y se vende como maíz o granos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semilla de maíz para la siembra.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ceferina is a member of the Communal Bank “Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos” which is located in the District of Urquillos, Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 56 years old, married, and has five children. Farming is her primary business activity, but she is also a small retailer. Ceferina buys and sells all types of vegetables such as squash, tomatoes, broccoli, cauliflower, beans, peas, carrots, onions, and lettuce. However, her main business activity is farming. She also sells white corn and yellow corn in bulk. When the corn is fresh, she sells it on the cob. As the corn ripens, she will allow it to finish drying out and then sell the dried kernels. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of corn seeds for planting.

Ceferina is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds for planting.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 41 years old, married has three children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the last five years, he has supported his family by owning and running a retail shop which he opened with money he made from farming. His main problems are high inflation and high rent, but he is determined to expand his shop into a wholesale operation and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, beers, wines and stationery to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with three children. Her husband works as a laborer in their community. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of foods.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling pig meat, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Aida dreams of purchasing a tricycle to transport the pig meat in the future.

With the PHP 17,000 she wants to purchase pigs and feed to fatten them for resale.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a responsible father who aims to continue sending his two children to college. He has owned and managed a rice field for almost 12 years now, earning an average net profit of only P15,000 every harvest season. He wants to increase his production in order to earn a higher income to cover up his children's financial needs and satisfy their basic necessities.

Due to financial difficulties, Victor has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides to pay for the labor costs of transplanting rice seedlings. He believes that the loan will help increase his rice production and income in the next harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the labor costs of transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Jose De La Rosa

texts.es:
José de 31 años de edad, vive en casa de unos familiares con su esposa e hija, cuenta con servicios básico sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.
