Desde hace 3 años José se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) golosinas y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos los gastos diarios de su familia.  

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea cada vez más grande y tenga productos surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y solventar sus necesidades.  José es una persona responsable y trabajadora que desea que su negocio crezca para poder seguir ayudando a su hija y esposa económicamente.
texts.en:
31-year-old José lives in a house belonging to some family members together with his wife and daughter.  The only basic service the house receives is electricity.  It is located in the urban area of Olmos district, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for its farming and livestock raising.

For three years, José has been selling essential household products (milk, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc), candies and drinks.  His business is located in his home for his convenience.  He uses the profits that he makes from selling his products to try and cover all his family's daily expenses.

In order to stock his business, José has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise.  His goal is to grow his business and have products in stock to offer his customers so that he can cover his needs.  José is a responsible and hard-working person who would like his business to grow so that he can continue helping his daughter and wife financially.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros, 57, is a straightforward and hard-working woman. She lives with her lovely husband and three children. She is a resident of Kompong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her greatest wish is to get ahead in life, so she makes a great effort every day. 

She has been running a business as a farmer. She's been doing this job for 21 years. This work is her main source of income so she has dedicated her life to doing it well. As a result, she earns a good income from her work.

She would like to purchase a motorbike but she lacks the money so she wishes to apply for a loan through Kiva partner HKL. This is her third loan with HKL, and the first loan with Kiva. 

She promises to repay the loan faithfully. She is sure that she can count on the support of lenders so she can continue to prosper. She is very grateful to all lenders that always help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma wants to expand her family business so she is taking out a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional items such as canned goods, biscuits and noodles to sell. She has operated her general store for over two years and earned about PHP 200 every day.

She is 36 years old, married and blessed with two school-aged children. Vilma hopes to grow her general store to secure her family's future and aims to educate her children so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving to earn and save for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as canned goods, biscuits and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Fetalai

texts.en:
Fetalai is 38 years old. She is married and has five children. Fetalai owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 5 years of experience in this business.  

Fetalai needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Fetalai joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Fetalai's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Kelin Jahayra

texts.es: Kelin de 26 años de edad,  vive en una zona periférica de San Pedro Sula. Tiene  dos hijos de 1 y 4 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años tiene un negocio, junto con su esposo,  de venta de cocos de manera ambulante. Este  negocio inicio por consejos de un amigo de su esposo, quien le dijo que generaba buenas ganancias.  Entonces decidieron esforzarse mucho. El compra los coco y ella lo prepara, luego lo trasladan en una bicicleta con freezer.  Ya tienen un  lugar donde estacionarse  que es estratégico para la venta,  enfrente del edificio del Seguro social. Sus ventas han sido buenas y le han  generado ingresos para el hogar. Ahora ya no sufren de hambre como antes. Con el fin de seguir creciendo solicitó un préstamo a ODEF para comprar una bicicleta mas y salir a vender los dos a distintos lugares.
texts.en:
Kelin, age 26, lives in an outlying area San Pedro Sula.  She has two children, ages one and four.

She has had her business for three years.  Together with her husband she sells coconuts in an itinerant manner.  She started this business on the advice of a friend of her husband.  He told her that it would generate good income. They decided to put forth great effort.

He buys the coconuts, and she prepares them.  Then they transport them on a bicycle with a freezer.  They have a place where they park, and it is a strategic place for sales.  It is in front of the Social Security building.

Their sales have been good, and they have generated income for the household.  Now they do not suffer from being hungry like before.

In order to continue growing she has requested a loan from ODEF.  She will buy another bicycle and use both bicycles to sell in different places.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle with a freezer.

loans.name: Twizerimana Group

texts.fr:
Virginie est une commerçante âgée de 46ans qui habite au Quartier de Nyabututsi  de la Ville  de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de bière industrielle depuis 7 ans. Elle est aussi enseignante. Elle a fait ses études jusqu'à l’obtention du Diplôme des Humanités pédagogiques. Elle est mariée a Louis et ont ensemble 8 enfants dont 7étudient. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 300,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bière industrielle à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Twizerimana»
texts.en:
Virginie, age 46, is a merchant who lives in the Nyabututsi neighborhood, in Gitega (center of the country). She's been selling industrial beer for seven years. She's also a teacher.

She pursued her studies until she obtained the "Diplôme des Humanités pédagogiques". She's married to Louis, and together they have eight children, out of whom seven attend school.

She's seeking a loan of BIF 300'000 (ca US$ 235) from Kiva, which will enable her to bolster her working capital to buy large quantities of industrial beer to resell, and increase her profits and savings.

Virginie is a member of Twizerimana Group.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of industrial beer

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid is a 44-year-old cattle breeder who has sold milk and dairy products for the last 17 years.  He is married and has four children.  Vahid is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  His monthly income comes from milk and yoghurt sales and it makes him 150 AZN per month.  He has applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase one milking cow and one bull.  He has a good client history and this will be his second loan from AqroInvest.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow and one bull.

loans.name: Ivan De Jesús

texts.es: El señor Iván a sus 54 años de edad, se dedica a la producción y comercialización de café en su finca ubicada en el municipio de Santa Bárbara localizado en el sur de Antioquia. La finca en la cual tiene sus cultivos el señor Iván la compro a un familiar hace 20 años con el dinero de una liquidación y  bonificación que le dieron al finalizar su trabajo en una finca de recreo, desde entonces ha construido su casa y mejorando los terreros para sus cultivos. El señor Iván desea comprar abonos para el cultivo de café, adecuación del lote y siembra de 1000 palos de café. Lo anterior le permitirá al señor Iván ampliar sus cultivos, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Iván, 54, is a coffee grower; his farm is located in the municipality of Santa Bárbara in southern Antioquia.  The farm where Iván has his coffee plants growing he purchased from a relative 20 years ago with money he got from bonuses and from his severance pay from a job he had at a recreational center.  Since then, he’s built his house and improved his farmland. 

Iván wants to buy manure for his coffee crops, to prepare the field and to buy 1000 coffee plants.  All of this will allow Iván to expand his crops, improve his income and thus improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, to prepare the field and to buy 1000 coffee plants.

loans.name: Edwin Gabriel

texts.es:
Edwin, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 6 meses, tienen casa propia, él se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, tiene 5 años de estar en esta actividad, trabaja de lunes a sábado, aprendió cuando aún vivía con sus padres.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de 5 sacos de abono y pago de mano de obra, esta producción mejorara y le ayudara para contar con el insumo necesario para fortalecer la siembra.
La aspiración de Edwin es obtener una buena cosecha, que sus cultivos tengan una producción abundante mediante la aplicación de los insumos que con este préstamo comprara.
texts.en:
Edwin lives with his wife and a 6-month-old son in a house they own. He sows basic grains. He has been in this line of work for five years and works from Monday through Saturday. He learned it while he was still living with his parents.
He requests the loan in order to purchase five sacks of compost and to pay for labor. The production will increase and help him get the inputs he needs to strengthen the sowing season. Edwin's goal is to obtain a good harvest and to see his crop result in abundant produce because of the inputs he will purchase with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of compost and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. Marlon provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 8 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline needed for the service. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marlon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Sante Mahoussi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SANTE MAHOUSSI est composé de deux personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Agbalé Alix est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Agbalé Alix est âgée de 22 ans et une célibataire. Agbalé Alix vit seule. Pour assurer ses divers besoins, Agbalé Alix mène comme activité depuis deux ans environs la coiffure. De façon secondaire, Agbalé Alix vend des produits de coiffure. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Agbalé Alix s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Agbalé Alix sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SANTE MAHOUSSI, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The SANTE MAHOUSSI group consists of two people who live in the same neighborhood.  This is the first time that this group is requesting financial aid from Alide in order to grow their business.  The representative of the group, named Agbale Alix, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Agbale Alix is 22 years old and single.  She lives alone.  To provide for her various needs, she has been a hairstylist for the past two years.  Secondarily, Agbale Alix sells hairstyling products.  This business allows her to take care of her expenses without much difficulty.  Agbale Alix stocks up at a market in Benin.  In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues and income, Agbale Alix together with the other member of the group SANTE MAHOUSSI is asking for a first loan from Alide.

loans.use: to buy hairstyling products.

loans.name: San Sok

texts.en: San Sok, 48, is widowed and lives with her six children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agriculture for over six years and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice, pineapple and fattening up cattle. Three of her children are employed — two in a mobile company and another in sales. In order to improve her family's living conditions, San Sok is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to carry her products to the market and also for family transportation. In the future, she would like to expand her business by growing more pineapples in her farmland. In addition, she would like to build a new house and support her children's studies until they get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry her agricultural products to sell at the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of the business.

loans.name: Ingilis

texts.en: Being an IDP, Ingilis settled in the Beylagan region. He decided to start a business to sustain the family and in 2003 he took out the first loan in for $400 from Normicro Beylagan branch. He is engaged in cattle breeding and selling. Now he wants $1100 to increase the number of livestock and to build a shed.

loans.use: To build a shed and increase livestock

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en: Nguyet is 56 years old, and her husband is 50 years old. They have two children, whose ages are 33 and 23. They have 2000 square meters of growing rice land, raising fish, pigs, and ducks for eggs. Their main income from this farm is only $10/person. Because of their low income, their children were forced to stop school in order to earn money by working as laborers in another province. Now, they hope to get a loan of $75 from the Kiva program to supply their farm. They believe that they are going to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Supplies for the farm

loans.name: Reina Marina

texts.es:
Mi nombre es Laura Isabel, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de Rosquillas, producto que distribuiyo de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tip de actividad, negocio que inicie con esfuerzo propio, debido a la necesidad sentida, ya que mi esposo se dedica a la agricultura y estoy ingresos se ven una vez al año, por lo que habia que bucar forma de tener ingreso diarios para los gastos familiares. gracias a este negocio mis hijos tienen la opurtunidad de estudiar.

My name is Laura Isabel, I make donuts and sell them in the streets of my community. I have dedicated many years to this type of activity, a business I started with personal effort driven by need. My husband is in agriculture and his income is seen only once a year, in turn we needed a daily income to meet the family expenses. Thanks to this business my children have the opportunity to study.

loans.use: Compra de queso, leche, maiz y leña//  Purchase of cheese, milk , and firewood

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena O. operates clothing and footwear kiosks in the markets of Berdyansk, Ukraine. Having graduated from Berdyansk Business School with a degree in business management, Yelena operates her business with excellence and expertise. Focused, committed, and known for her integrity, Yelena carries an excellent reputation among both clients and entrepreneurs in her region. With her excellent work ethic, Yelena has multiplied her turnover capital five times since she opened her business.

Currently, Yelena is seeking a $500 loan to re-stock her inventory and seasonal clothing. With the additional income, she plans to open a new vending facility in Berdyansk as well as continue supporting her family and two sons.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 58 years old and has ten children and 22 grandchildren. She is married, and five of her children still live in her house. She buys fruits and vegetables in bulk from the surrounding local farms and sells them in the nearby city markets, such as in La Romana and El Seybo. Right now it is avocado season and that is currently her main product.

Aida took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 4th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other three. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can take out larger and larger amounts. Aida is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

With her profits from her small business, Aida says that she can help provide for her family, buying food and medicine for her children and grandchildren. Her goal with this loan is to keep moving forward with her business, increasing her sales little by little as she eventually is able to sell more and more produce at local markets.

loans.use: To invest in her business and better provide for her children and grandchildren

loans.name: Kokou Omer

texts.fr:
Born in Afagnan on August 6, 1969, Mr D. Kokou Omer is married and a father of two (2) children. His wife is a seamstress who only slightly contributes to the household needs. Mr D. has a secondary education and is a computer maintenance technician who has just completed his training. He is asking for a loan of $800 in order to buy a workplace computer, a printer and a photocopier in order to open a text processing and printing center. From the income gained, he will be able to refund his loan and improve the living conditions of his children.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Afagnan, le 06 Août 1969, Monsieur D. Kokou Omer est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Sa femme est couturière qui contribue légèrement aux charges du ménage. Instruit de niveau secondaire, Monsieur D. est un informaticien maintenancier qui vient d’achever son apprentissage. Il compte saisir cette opportunité pour solliciter ce crédit de $800 afin d’acheter un poste ordinateur, une imprimante et un photocopieur afin d’ouvrir un centre de traitement de texte. A partir des recettes il pourra rembourser son crédit et améliore les conditions de vie de ses enfants.

loans.use: Buying a computer, printer and copier

loans.name: Ashur

texts.ru:
Ashur D. is 56 and has a secondary school education. He is married with six children. Rustam has been breeding livestock for four years and this is his main source of income. He plans to use his loan to purchase two young bulls to fatten and sell. After he sells them, in 40-45 he will buy more young animals to raise and sell over ten months. At the end of the credit cycle he will retain three bulls as profit. Ashur plans to repay his loan over a ten month period.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Дониев Ашур, возраст – 56 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Ашур в течение 4 лет занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота и этот вид деятельности является основным источником приносящий ему доход. Он планирует на сумму кредита приобретсти 2 бычков для откормки и продажи. Продавать бычков клиент собирается через 40-45дней после откормки. Затем он будет покупать молодняк, откармливать и опять продавать, и так в течение 10 месяцев. В конце кредитного цикла ему в качестве прибыли, согласно подготовленного прогноза должно остаться 3 бычка. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase new livestock

loans.name: Lizarda

texts.es:
Lizarda belongs to the Mujeres con Futuro community bank located at Jr. Arenal 1210, Calleria, Ucayali. She is 65 years old, a widow, and a mother of 6. Her children are all older now, but still keep an eye on her. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, totaling 300 sols, she decided to start selling soft drinks out of her home.

She has continued selling refreshments as well as popsicles, ice, jello and mineral water. She wakes up at 7 a.m. to make her breakfast and await and tend to her clients throughout the day.

With the loan valued at 1,700 sols ($600), which she will pay back in 5 months, she will purchase 4 boxes of carbonated beverages and use the rest little by little for jello and other drinks.

Lizarda is a hard-working woman and, despite her age, she has the energy to move forward and support herself. She is very thankful for the support Manuela Ramos has provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Lizarda pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. Arenal 1210, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 65 años, es viuda y madre de 6 hijos, todos mayores de edad, pero que siempre están pendiente de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas en su domicilio.

En la actualidad continúa con la venta de gaseosas, chupetes, hielo, gelatina y agua mineral. Se levanta a las 7 a.m. para preparar su desayuno y estar pendiente de sus clientes para atenderlos durante todo el día.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 4 cajas de gaseosas y el resto lo irá invirtiendo poco a poco en gelatinas y demás bebidas.

Lizarda es una mujer luchadora y a pesar de su edad, tiene las energías para seguir adelante y valerse por si misma. Está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos durante todo el tiempo que está con ellas.

loans.use:
To purchase carbonated beverages and other drinks

Compra de gaseosas y otros

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
M. Saodat is 37 years old. She is married with six children. 

Saodat is an entrepreneur. She sells the confectioneries and candies and sweets. Saodat purchases the goods in the market of Dushanbe city and sells them in the local market of her home city. Saodat’s business is the main source of income for her family, and her husband is ready to help her. For 8 years the business has been successful in generating the stable income for this large family. Today Saodat requests 2,000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 6 months. The loan shall be used for increasing the working capital required for purchasing the confectioneries for selling. Getting a loan for the first time, Saodat thanks all for supporting her and promises to be precise in loan payment.

loans.use: Increasing the confectioneries and candies for selling.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. prepares palm oil to sell. She is married and has three children. She wants to increase production but lacks funding.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more oil palm fruit, which is the major raw material for the oil production.

loans.use: To buy more oil palm fruit to produce more palm oil

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 30 years old and is single. She take care of one person who is 80 years old. Saumu is a coconut seller. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more coconuts for her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Matiyande Group

texts.en:
Mohamed K. is the Matiyande group leader and is also a Kiva client who has completed his payment. With the previous loan, Mohamed increased his stock and income and has invested part of the profit in farming. Like the other 3 members, Fatmata K., Kati K., and Seray M., Mohamed sells agricultural products such as peanuts, rice, beans, etc. They buy the products from the farmers and sell to retailers, thus taking the economy into the villages.

The group is requesting a loan of Le.3,600,000 to increase their stock and reduce transportation costs and time spent on frequent traveling. Mohamed is 36 years old and married with 3 children.

loans.use: To increase stock and income

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Mother Astou B., as most people call her, is a merchant of various products that she sells in front of her home located in Keur Massamba Gueye Peulh. She also manages a very big family as she is married and a mother of 7 children. This is her 10th loan with U-IMCEC since she has been a member of the mutual funds company since 2001. She wants to grow her business and diversify the products offered in order to satisfy her loyal clientele.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mère Astou B. comme on a l'habitude de l'appeler est une commerçante de produits divers qu'elle vend devant sa maison sise à Keur massamba Gueye Peulh. Gérante d'une très grande famille elle est mariée et mère de 7enfants. Elle est à son 10ème prêt avec U-IMCEC car elle est membre de la mutuelle depuis 2001. Elle veut renforcer et varier ses produits pour satisfaire sa fidèle clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Unidos Por El Progreso Group

texts.en:
Pilar is a 48-year old woman who lives with her husband and son (age 6) in a small town called Sabana in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. Pilar operates her own `fritura´, a small business that makes homemade snacks such as empanadas. She makes the food in her home and then sells it in the street. In the Dominican Republic, it is very common for people to buy a snack on the street corners as they walk to work, their homes, or simply when they are out and about.

The money from this loan will help her to buy enough ingredients such as flour, oil, corn, sugar, and chicken to make the food necessary to meet the demand she faces. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more stable with the help of this loan. Eventually Pilar hopes to save enough money to buy a refrigerator so that she can store meat for longer periods of time. In the meantime, she continues to work hard to provide for her family and better their living conditions.

Pilar is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, Unidos por el Progreso. In English, this means `united to progress´. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.

On behalf of Pilar, the Rayo de Luz group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy corn, flour, sugar, chicken, and oil for her fritura

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana A. is 46 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school while the other two have graduated. Susana has much experience with customer service, having been in the business of selling yams and dried fish for twenty years as a way to support her family. She treks to nearby farming communities to buy her stock of yams, and she gets her fish from fish mongers. This saves her the cost of dealing with middlemen, who buy from farmers and resell to stores at a higher price.

Susana has applied for a loan to buy yams in bulk and enough dried fish to meet the needs of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to pay for her children's education. Susana is a member of a loan group called Ruth Love Trust Group. Members guarantee and support one another in the repayment of their loans.

loans.use: To buy yams and dried fish in bulk

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Cao Thi T. is 48 years old. Her husband is a pensioner. She joined TYM Fund in 1998 and borrowed VND 500,000 to raise pigs. Up to this time, her family's pig raising business has been expanding. That is why she wants to borrow VND 15 million to fix her pig-pen and buy bran in order to raise more pigs.

loans.use: Pig raising

loans.name: Scolastica B.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Scolastica B. M. from Kyela, divorced with one child aged 12. Since 2005, Scolastica has been operating a shop selling items such as rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and salt. Assisted by her sister, she works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and earns about $110 each month.

Scolastica is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more food items in bulk and as well as open a cosmetics shop alongside her shop. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more food items in bulk and open a cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es: El Sr. Jose Mercedes habita en la Cmca. Masapia junto a su familia compuesta por su Sra. Socorro Somoza y 2 hijos menores, los que estudian 2do y 3er grado de primaria, muy temprano atiende su cultivo de arroz de 3 Mzs a la que le brinda el manejo adecuado; la Sra. Socorro es profesora de la escuela de la comunidd, don Jose es socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza, la que a traves de 1 proyecto le permite acceder como socio de 1 trillo, teniendo que aportar el monto de C$.15,000.00.  Su sueño es alcanzar esa meta y asi reducir sus costos de produccion y por ende obtener mayores beneficios que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Mercedes lives in the Masapia neighborhood with his family which consists of Mrs. Socorro Somoza and their two young children who are studying in 2nd and 3rd grade of elementary school. Jose tends to his 3 blocks of rice fields early every morning which brings him a decent income. Mrs. Socorro es a teacher in the community school. Jose is a member of the agricultural cooperative La Esperanza (Hope), which allows him to become a partner in the purchase of a rice threshing machine if he can contribute $775. His dream is to realize this goal and reduce his production costs in order to improve his income and the living conditions of his family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribute 30% to the construction of a rice threshing machine

loans.name: I Ketut Sarna

texts.id:
I Ketut Sarna, tinggal disebuah desa di Bali barat yang hampir semua penduduknya berprofesi sebagai petani. Karena tinggal didaerah yang terpencil, hampir semua petani didaerahnya bercocok tanam dengan cara yang sangat tradisional. Hal itu berakibat kepada hasil yang tidak maksimal dan bahkan seringkali kekurangan untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga. I Ketut Sarna mendapat informasi dari temannya yang juga seorang petani dari lain desa. Petani tersebut sudah berhasil karena bercocok tanam dengan cara modern dan menggunakan bibit padi jenis unggul.
I Ketut Sarna ingin menjadi pelopor untuk mengadakan perubahan didesanya. Ia ingin menanami sawahnya dengan bibit padi kwalitas unggul untuk hasil yang maksimal. Untuk mewujudkan hal itu, I Ketut Sarna mengajukan pinjaman ke Yayasan Dinari dan mohon pembinaan untuk proses menanamnya. Dengan adanya pendampingan usaha dari Dinari dan bantuan dari temannya yang telah sukses, I Ketut Sarna optimis usahanya akan berhasil dan akan menjadi contoh didesanya.
texts.en:
I Ketut Sarna lives in a village in the west of Bali. Almost all men in that village are farmers. They are using traditional ways in farming because their village is located in a remote area. As a result they cannot get the best result from their farming activities.

I Ketut Sarna got an information from his friend who live in another village. His friend is a successful farmer because he already uses modern farming methods and also he uses high quality paddy seeds. I Ketut Sarna wants to be pioneer in the modern farming method in his village. He also wants to pioneering the usage of high quality paddy seeds.

Therefore he applied for a loan of IDR 6 million (around USD 550) from Dinari foundation. He also requested to be guided by Dinari Foundation's farming specialist so he can succeed in this. He is hoping that he can succeed in this so he can inspire his fellow village men.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: High quality paddy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos Antonio, casado, de 50 años de esda, de oficio trabajador industrial, con 2 hijos, una niña que cursa el primer grado y un varon de 2 años de edad, su esposa no trabaja fuera de la casa, maneja un negocio de venta de muebles de madera finos del esposo, el trabaja en el Matadero MACESA ubicado en la comarca San Esteban de Juigalpa, con 5 años de servicio, trabaja de Lunes a Domingo con horario de 5:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. como recortador de carne cortes selectos.  Don Marcos ha demostrado responsabilidad en el pago de sus 4 creditos anteriores, pues desde el 2004 esta trabajando con AFODENIC, manifesto que gracias  a los creditos que se le han otorgado ya cuenta con una vivienda digna, pues cuando inicio con AFODENIC solo contaba con el terreno, ahora tiene una vivienda con 2 dormitorios, sala, comedor, cocina amplia, pintada con piso de ceramica, etc.; este 5to credito lo utilizara para comprar zinc y perlines para  techar un galeron que utilizara para el lavado y el planchado y darle mejores condiciones a su esposa para que no se moje con el invierno y no se asolee.
texts.en:
Don Marcos Antonio is married, 50 years old, an industrial worker with 2 children; a girl in first grade and a two-year-old boy. His wife does not work outside their home, she manages her husband's business selling furniture made of fine woods. Mr. Marcos Antonio has been working for 5 years at the MACESA slaughter house located in San Esteban de Juigalpa, from Monday through Sunday from 5:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m as a cutter of selective cuts. Don Marcos has shown responsability repaying 4 previous loans. He has been working with AFODENIC since 2004 and thanks to the loans he owns a decent home. When he started with AFODENIC he only had the land, now he has a dwelling with 2 bedrooms, living room, dining room, big kitchen, all painted, with ceramic floors, etc. The 5th loan will be spent on buying zinc and purlins to cover the area used for laundry and ironing with a roof, to offer more comfort to his wife so that she will neither get wet during winter nor stand in the sun.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc and purlins.

loans.name: Grupo Los Artesanos 0103023-2 Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Los Artesanos compuesto de tres integrantes de la comarca de Las Flores del municipio de Masaya, Los miembros del grupo son: Gloria del Carmen M., Yolanda del Socorro C. y José Alberto L. G..

Doña Gloria del Carmen tiene un pequeño taller de artesanía menor, que es elaboración de zapatos, carteras, billeteras, etc. trabaja junto a su esposo y sus hijos con un trabajador contratado, la producción la vende en el mercado de Masaya y Granada. Está satisfecha de poder proporcionar trabajo a su familia y a otra persona más 
Tiene 9 años de realizar esta actividad que la heredó de su suegro y poco a poco con el crédito de Adim han podido salir adelante, el crédito lo necesita para comprar cuero y suelas para zapatos.
Sueña con poder tener un taller grande y tener ganancias para independizar el taller de su casa de habitación y mejorar el nivel de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Los Artesanos group is made up of three members of the Las Flores district of the Masaya municipality. The members of the group are: Gloria del Carmen M., Yolanda del Socorro C. and José Alberto L. G.. Ms. Gloria del Carmen has a small handicrafts workshop where she makes shoes, wallets, billfolds, etc. She works with her husband and children, as well as a contracted worker. She sells her products at the market at Masaya and Granada. She is satisfied that she is able to provide work for her family and also to provide a job for someone else. She has been making handicrafts since she inherited the workshop from her father-in-law 9 years ago. Little by little, with the loan credits from Adim, she has been able to get ahead. She is asking for this loan to buy leather and soles to make shoes. She dreams of having a big workshop and have enough earnings to separate the workshop from her home in order to improve the quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather and soles to make shoes

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.es: Cerilo tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Es transportista que desde hace 10 años, ofrece servicio de carga con su principal herramienta de trabajo, su camión, en el cual principalmente transporta ganado. En un inicio su camión  era solo para transportar los animales que él mismo vendía, pero al notar que en cada pueblo donde se comercializa ganado es muy solicitado el servicio de transporte, fue dedicándose a esta actividad. Viaja constantemente a diferentes ciudades, aprovechando para comprar productos de cada zona para venderlos en su próximo destino. Ahora que empieza la época escolar es cuando tiene mayores ganancias por haber mayor demanda del servicio de transporte. El anhelo de Cerilo es adquirir otro camión para  incrementar sus ganancias. Es la tercera vez que lleva un crédito con su banco comunal y MFP, para él ha sido una experiencia muy satisfactoria. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará para el mantenimiento de su camión, lo que está valorizado en un monto aproximado de 2300 soles y con la otra parte, comprará mercadería de ocasión para vender en otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Cerilo is 43 years old; he lives with his wife and two children. He has been a transport driver for the past 10 years: he offers cargo services with his truck, mainly transporting livestock. Initially he used his truck to only transport animals which he was selling but he noticed that in each village where livestock was sold, this transportation service was in high demand and so he went into this line of business. He travels constantly from city to city, always buying products from each area to sell at his next destination. Now, with the school year starting, it is the best time of year for him to make the greatest profit because demand for his services is so high. Cerilo's goal is to acquire another truck to increase his profit. This is his third loan with his community bank and MFP. He has found the loan experience to be very satisfactory. He will use the loan to perform maintenance on his truck, which he estimates will cost 2,300 soles, and the remainder will be used to buy second-hand goods to resell in other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Truck maintenance

loans.name: Asha H.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Asha N., a 31-year-old woman from Mbeya. She is married, and she has a 7-year-old child. In addition, she is responsible for supporting two other dependants who are orphans.

Since 2003, Asha has been operating a crop-selling business. Specifically, she purchases crops from the nearby farming village and then sells the crops in town for a profit. She works at the business 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Asha currently earns approximately $80 per month from her business. Now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 in order to purchase more crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to sell a wider variety of crops to further expand her business. Asha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional crops in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E.'s goal is to work hard and be productive. Through dedication and commitment she is living up to that. She sells cooked eggs with pepper and assorted biscuits by a road in Cape Coast, Ghana called Moore Junction.

Mary says she enjoys selling them and has done so for 10 years and is now in taking care of the home. Mary E. is 31 years old, married and the mother of a child who is currently in school.

She arranges the eggs on a tray and mostly sells to travelers. Mary treks to the poultry farmers in Ashanti and the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana to purchase the eggs. She does not have sufficient capital to buy more. She is requesting a loan to realize her dream of taking care of the family.

With the loan she wants to buy more from farmers to avoid frequent traveling which she believes is retarding her sales. Mary will be grateful for your loan support. Mary belongs to a group called ‘Gina Pin Tin’ which means Stand Firm.

loans.use: Buy eggs to sell.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
“Grace comes from God, and action should be done by us,” said Domingo C.. Domingo is a resident of Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married to Lorna and gifted with seven children. Most of their children are high school graduates, while some of them, particularly the younger ones, are presently studying in the secondary and elementary levels. Domingo and his wife are working hard to support the education of their children and hope that someday they can graduate from college and have a better future.  

Due to the economic crisis that they are experiencing, the couple is having a hard time sending their children to school since their income from farming is not enough. Thus, Domingo came up with the idea of venturing into the hog raising business. He is planning to use his income from his hog raising for the education of his children and for farming assistance. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP as financial assistance to his business. Domingo will utilize the loan to buy at least three sacks of feed for his hogs and some will be used to buy some farming inputs.  He hopes that he will be able to improve his hog raising business, and at the same time, increase his crop production through this loan.

loans.use: To improve his hog raising and farming businesses

loans.name: Gulchahon

texts.ru: Гулчахон получает займ в МикроИнвест уже второй раз. Она работает в колхозе, муж находиться на заработках в России. Гулчахон 37 лет, имеет 4 детей. Дополнительно к своему заработку в колхозе и денежным переводам от мужа с России Гулчахон дома откармливает скот. Условия для откорма имеются и поэтому у нее несколько голов скота дома. Раз в месяц или два она выводит на базар готовый к убою скот и продает. А на прибыль расходует на питание семьи. Новый займ собирается приобрести маленького бычка.
texts.en:
Gulchahon is getting a loan from MicroInvest for the second time. She works on a collective farm; her husband is in Russia earning money. Gulchahon is 37 years old and has 4 children. In addition to her earnings at the collective farm and money transfers from her husband in Russia Gulchahon fattens cattle at home. She has the right conditions to fatten livestock and this is why she has several heads of livestock at home. Once a month or twice she takes livestock that is ready to be butchered to the market and sells it. She uses the profits to feed her family. She is taking out a new loan to purchase a small bull.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Rusembe 2 East Nyago Evelyn Group

texts.en:
Evelyn N. is a 28 year old old business lady. She is married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Evelyn has been in business for two years but does not have sufficient capital. She will use this loan to purchase charcoal and food stuff, such as cassava, bananas and sweet potatoes, to add stock to her business and earn more profit.

She is a hardworking lady whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal and food stuff.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en: Aiza O. runs a hog raising business in their village. She is now 21 years old and married to Alex, who is construction worker. Aiza wants to provide their future children with a good education and a progressive living someday. Thus, the couple has joined hands to develop their poor living situation. She is requesting to borrow from lenders a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 as additional working capital in order to maintain her hog raising business and to be able to finance the animal feed supply. Aiza also is hoping that her business will become bigger and she will be able to develop a good family with harmonious relationships, especially when they will have the children they long for, to complete their family in the future. She prays that her loan will be granted soon to further develop her business to progress.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is fifty years old, married, and the mother of six children. She is a resourceful mother and she works with the motivation of supporting her children’s education to provide them with better life opportunity in future. At the moment, two of her children are in school while the rest have completed school and are working.

Janet sells corn dough, which is milled maize grains mixed with water. It is used to prepare local meals like banku (cooked and served with hot pepper or soup) and porridge. Janet wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize to increase her production of corn dough. She supplies mostly to food vendors in her community but she also hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: seynabou M. est vendeuse de vaisselles depuis plus de deux(02)ans.elle a une tres grande experience dans ce domaine elle est mariee et mere de deux(02)enfants et compte sur son activites pour soutenir son mari dans les charges domestiques.elle sollicite un pret de cent(mille)frs pour augmenter son stock .
texts.en:
Seynabou M. has been a seller of dishware, pots, and pans for over two years. She has a lot of experience in this domain. She is married and the mother of two and is counting on her business to help her husband with domestic expenses. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase her inventory of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children. She married very young and she was not able to graduate in college because of lack of money to support her tuition. Currently, she is helping her husband, Joenifer S. to till the 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) farm. In addition to rice, she also raises chickens in their backyard to be able to help supplement their income for all their family daily expenses.

Ruby is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy thirty liters of fuel and two bags of complete fertilizer.

Ruby is convinced of the value of the wide services offered to her by CEVI. She doesn't just have loans but she receives training and insurance as well.

loans.use: To purchase thirty liters of fuel and two bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es: Oscar Manuel M. M. tiene 34 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadearía en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Cuando el tomo la iniciativa de comprar mercadería, pero debido a que su capital de trabajo era muy poco no podía comprar la variedad de productos necesarios para atraer más clientes, con la ayuda de un amigo que le facilito algo de dinero logro salir adelante e invertir en mas productos. El mayor desafío de Oscar fue dedicarles tiempo suficiente a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Su deseo es poder mejorar los ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Madame Fati est une dame qui a ouvert une grande boutique de vente de produits hétéroclites dans le quartier d’Agoè Zongo à Lomé. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2002 ; il est marié à un éleveur de bœufs. Le couple a 05 enfants à sa charge. C’est parce que les revenus du foyer n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins du couple que cette dame a décidé d’ouvrir cette boutique. Elle vend des cigarettes, des rasoirs, des produits désodorisants, des déodorants, des produits de beauté, des papiers de toilettes. C’est pour disposer d’un nouveau stock qu’elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 cartouches de cigarettes Fine, 15 cartouches de cigarette Yes, 05 cartons de produits désodorisants ainsi que d’autres produits manquants.

loans.use: Achat de cigarettes, de désodorisants et divers articles

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y decidida, vive en la casa de sus familiares, junto a su esposo Rubén de 48 años y sus 2 hijos: Rubén de 18 y Jakelin de 8 años, a quienes desea dar una mejor vida. La venta de carne le ha dado a Juana los ingresos necesarios par mantener a su familia, ella tiene su puesto en el mercado Las mercedes (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido, ya que la carne que vende es muy fresca y sabrosa, lo cual le ha hecho una buena fama y le trae mucho clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre la carne que más sabor le dará a sus comidas, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir. Para el futuro espera tener una carnicería más grande en la cual pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.
Este es el tercer préstamo de Juana con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para ello tenga que ahorrar poco a poco. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeros. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más carne, ya que últimamente la demanda a crecido.
texts.en:
Juana is 46 years old and very hardworking and decisive. She lives together with her husband Ruben, who is 48 years old, and their two children, ages 18 and 8. She would like to improve the quality of life for her children. Running her butcher shop has provided the income Juana needs to help support her family. She has a small stand in the Las Mercedes market, the most important market in the city of Juliaca. She has many customers, and she is well known for the quality and freshness of the meat she sells. What she enjoys most about her work is being able to offer advice to her customers about which cuts of meat provide the best flavor for the meals they prepare. Juana has been doing this work for 30 years. It is very hard work as she needs to be at her small stand all day and cannot leave. In the future, she would like to have a larger butcher shop where she'll be better able to serve more customers. This is Juana's third loan with MFP, and she is responsible in making timely payments, though she must save little by little. In her communal bank, Juana is an active member and team player, winning her the respect of fellow members. With the money from this loan, she will purchase more meat to sell, as lately she has had more demand from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat to stock her small butcher shop in the market

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, es una mujer de un agradable carácter, tiene 39 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos. Desde pequeña aprendió con sus padres el cultivo de kion, piñas y plátanos, de los cuales el más rentable y de menor inversión es el kion, por ello es que con su esposo se han avocado más a este cultivo. Para la venta, cuentan con una vecina de su pueblo que es comerciante mayorista, a quien le venden toda su cosecha. La única dificultad es el transporte de los sacos desde su chacra hasta el pueblo, pues es una hora en carro, en una zona de difícil acceso y que en los tiempos de lluvias se empeora el traslado; pese a ello, María sigue sembrando en estas chacras porque son su única fuente de ingresos económicos.

Este es su 2do crédito con MFP, durante el ciclo pasado fue tesorera de su banco comunal, pero para este prestamos cedió esta responsabilidad a otra socia. Este dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus chacras de kion.
texts.en:
María is a woman with a pleasant disposition. She is 39 years old and lives with her partner, who is the father of their 4 children. Since childhood, María learned from her parents how to cultivate ginger, pineapples, and bananas. Of these crops, the one that is most profitable and requires less investment is ginger. Her husband also grows avocados. María has a neighbor who is a wholesaler and sells her entire harvest for her. Her only difficulty is transporting the bags of produce from her farm into town, since the trip takes an hour by car and can be more difficult when it rains. Despite these challenges, María continues to farm because it is her only source of income.

This is her second loan with MFP. During the previous loan cycle, she served as Communal Bank treasurer but she has handed that responsibility to another member. With the money she requested, María will buy chemical fertilizers for her ginger crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha M. D. G. resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo don Juan D. 60 años D. edad. Hace quince años Bertha tiene una tienda D. comestibles y otros artículos para el hogar, el negocio D. Bertha le ha permitido sostener los gastos del hogar, gracias a la demanda que posee por ser una tienda muy reconocida en la zona , para Bertha su negocio sigue teniendo las posibilidad D. crecer es por ello que en esta oportunidad ella solicita D. un crédito que le la oportunidad D. surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha M. D. G. resides in the Ahuachapan region with her husband Juan, who is 60 years old. For 15 years Bertha has had a store selling food and other household items. Bertha's business has allowed her to proviD. for the household expenses, thanks to strong demand at the store, which is very well known in the area. Bertha believes that her business continues to have growth possibilities, and for this reason she is requesting a loan that will give her the opportunity to stock up her store with merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for harvesting corn

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna R. is from the village of Lumgan, Valencia City. She is 51 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Edna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling food and other products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Edna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to reinvest in her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase more products for her store. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es una socia entusiasta y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 53 años, es madre de seis hijos(3 de ellos mayores de edad)y se dedica a la venta de dulces por lo que sale a vender por las tardes por diferentes lugares de la localidad. 
Esperanza forma parte del Banco Comunal “Perlas de Pucallpa” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtiò en frutas para la venta desde su casa.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà dulces y frutas. 
El anhelo de Esperanza es llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes al por menor.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a very enthusiastic and hard working woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the region of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are full grown. She sells sweets in the afternoon in different locations around town.

Esperanza is a member of the village bank "Perlas de Pucallpa" (Pearls of Pucallpa). She has been a member for a year and a half and her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles which she used to buy fruit to sell from her home.

Now she needs a loan of 600.00 nuevos soles to buy sweets and fruits. Esperanza dreams of having a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying sweets and fruit

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila B. is 54 years old and is married with three children. She is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family.

More than fifteen years ago, Rahila got an idea to start raising cattle to contribute to her family's finances, taking advantage of the space she had available at her house for this business. Her son helps her with the business.

With an endless list of requests, Rahila has finally decided to increase the number of the animals she keeps. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN. Please be an important part of the growth of Rahila’s business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy, 35 years old, has businesses in rice farming and hog raising located in Norala, South Cotabato. The eldest of her four children is 5 years old. The income she receives is enough to provide for the basic needs of her family. For her to help finance her business, she seeks a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., since it provides the lowest interest rate.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Mrs. Chreb S. is 39 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field used to cultivate rice to earn a living. She now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and a pesticide container to support the crops. Her husband, Mr. Sein Chao, is a laborer in the local village. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and a pesticide container

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Rekavo Group

texts.en: The Women Entrepreneurs' Committee of Villa Hayes Chaco is in it's first cycle and the loans are from 100,000 gs to 300,000 gs.  Most of the clients sell soft drinks; others sell perfume or linen goods, or raise animals.  Thanks to the loan obtained through Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya, these women are able to get ahead in life.

loans.use: Purchase meat, animals, linen

loans.name: Virgo Jay's Group

texts.en: Virgo Jay D. is from the village of De Vera, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 33 years old and is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Virgo Jay is married and has three school-aged children. He owns and operates a food stall, selling fruits and vegetable in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Virgo Jay joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from ASKI. Virgo Jay plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is the leader of three members of a group. She is married with two children. Both of her children go to school. She resides in and rents a one-room house where she is staying with four people. Rehema takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area. She incurs little transport costs to and from buying chickens from Bwaise. She does her shopping twice a week and buys from Bwaise market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city.  She sells to 10 customers a day. Rehema sells to all categories of people at retail and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include daily market dues, rent for her residence and medication. She has been in this business for eight years. Rehema has been with MCDT for two weeks, servicing her first loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more chickens for resale. Rehema hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start raising chickens herself.

Rehema is wearing a brown skirt in the middle of the photo with her three group mates.  
 

.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for reasle

loans.name: Mary Flor

texts.en:
Mary Flor dreams that her business will grow. She is 31 years old and sells fish for a living. She is married with two children that she sends to school. Like any other mother, she only wants the best for her family. She wants to be able to provide for the increasing needs in her household. 

Mary Flor joined CEVI in 2006. She said that she likes its program, especially its savings policy. She would like to request a loan of PHP 13,000 that she would use to buy fishing nets and other materials. Receiving this loan is truly helpful to Mary Flor as she reaches for her dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mr. S., 24, is a single man who sells firewood. He also goes to carve firewood from the forest to sell at his house. He now lives with his old mother who helps him sell the carved wood. He is currently a hardworking man who tries to earn money to support his family's daily expenses and to pay the school fees for his siblings. S. would like to ask for a loan as capital to buy a medium boat that he will use to deliver passengers and merchandise for a fee. This action will provide him with extra income and a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy a medium boat.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. FELICITAS,  ella tiene 38 años de edad, es casaca y tiene  1 hijo, Nuestra socia alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y como cuyes, chanchos, aves de corral,  y a la agricultura, nuestra socia tiene su terreno en el cual cultiva maíz, papa, hortalizas; la socia vende lo que cosecha y a sus animales menores también, ella desea el préstamo para aumentar la producción de animales menores.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicita belongs to the Virgen Inmaculada Concepción (Virgin of the Immaculate Conception) Communal Bank and lives in the district of Anta, in Anta province, Cusco department. Felicita is 38 years old, married, and has one child. She alternates between retail commerce and raising farm animals, including guinea pigs, hogs, and chickens, and agriculture. On her land she cultivates corn, potatoes, and vegetables. Felicita sells what she harvests as well as her animals. She requests a loan to increase animal production. Felicita is grateful for and values the help offered by this means and promises to comply with the repayment of her debt in the time established.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INCREASING PRODUCTION OF THE FARM ANIMALS SHE SELLS

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 27 years old. He is married and has a one-year-old child. He is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu. Patrick has beeen farming for six years; his product is bananas which he sells to the middlemen who later sell them to the local market. He also operates a shop in the same area.

He recently completed repayment of a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 40,000 KES and has requested a new loan for 80,000 KES to constuct a better cowshed and upgrade his banana farming. The income from this loan will help him buy more land and later buy a car that will help boost his income.

His main challenges in farming are the low banana prices during the rainy season and natural hazards, like wind which causes banana stems to break. He plans to start potato farming bacause he has already identified a ready market for it.

He says that Juhudi gives loans through the group-guarantee mechanism and this makes it easier to access credit to boost his farming.

loans.use: To construct a cow shed and upgrade his banana farming

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel G. D. R. D. 40 años D. edad, trabaja en su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda en la que se comercializan productos D. primera necesidad como pan, agua, gas propano, medicinas y algunas golosinas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación en el municipio D. Ilopango, en el departamento D. San Salvador. María es una madre D. familia muy responsable la cual vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas D. 12 y 2 años D. edad, D. los cuales la mayor se dedica a estudiar. María desea mucho el poder surtir en gran medida su negocio, ya que D. esta forma podrá vender más y obtener más ganancias, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios para brindarles todo lo que sus clientes buscan, D. esta forma ella podrá brindar un mejor servicio el cual se vea recompensado con más clientes. Para María su negocio es muy importante ya que cuenta con la ventaja D. poseerlo en su hogar lo cual le permite atenderlo y así mismo estar junto a sus hijas a las cuales al mismo tiempo les pueD. brindar todo lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
María Isabel G. D. R., 40, works in her own store where she stocks first need items like: bread, water, propane gas, medicines, some snacks. Her store is located in her home in the town of Ilopango, San Salvador department. María is a very responsible mother who lives with her husband and her two daughters who are 12 and 2 years of age; the older daughter is in school. María would love to have a wider variety of stock available in her store because this would lead to increased sales and profits. This is why she’s asking for funding in order to buy all the products she needs to meet all her customers’ needs, something she hopes will lead to new customers. María’s store is very important to her because she has the advantage of having it in her home which allows her to be near her daughters and thereby proviD. them with everything they might need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Groupe 1 De Bogoba Togo

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe 1 de l’association Bogoba de Togo sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Togo dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs parcelles de cultures et de pouvoir recruter des hommes (manœuvres) pour le labour et le sarclage au cours de la saison des pluies, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne, le premier fut correctement remboursé.  Elles cultivent du mil,  de l’arachide  et du haricot.
 Madame Fatoumata  Tata Sangaré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs d’engrais, 50 kg de semence  d’arachide et recruter la main d’œuvre masculine pour les activités de labour et de désherbage. 
Elle se ravitaille en semences et en engrais à la foire de Ségou (au grand marché). Elle espère sur sa superficie de 2 hectares pour produire 9 sacs d’arachide, 4 sacs de mil, 300kg deharicot et des fanes de haricot destinées à faire des bottes. 
Les bottes de haricot sont stockées et vendues pendant la période de soudure. Une partie de la récolte est auto consommée tandis que l’autre moitié est destinée à la vente. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour acheter les condiments hebdomadairement dans les foires et les soins de santé des enfants. 
Elle a comme objectif à l’instar des autres membres du groupe d’assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire dans le village.
texts.en:
The eight members of Group 1 of the Bogoba de Togo association are married women, mostly from large extended traditional families, who average 43 years of age and 3 children. They all live in the village of Togo, in the country commune of Sakoïba in Ségou Region (4th administrative region of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of kinship and marriage. In order to expand their farming lots and to be able to hire laborer for plowing and weeding during the rainy season, they're seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. The first farming loan was repaid without problems. They grow millet, peanuts, and beans. Mrs. Fatoumata Tata Sangaré intends to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of fertilizers, 50 kg of peanut seeds, and to hire male workforce for plowing and weeding. She gets her supplies of seeds and fertilizers at the fair in Ségou (at the grand market). On her area of 2 hectares, she hopes to produce 9 sacks of peanuts, 4 sacks of millet, 300 kg of beans, and bean stalk leaves to make sheaves. Beans sheaves are stored and sold during the off-season. Part of the harvest is for their own consumption, whereas the other half is for selling. The achieved profit is used to buy food condiments on a weekly basis in fairs, and to pay for children healthcare. Like the other members of the group, her goal is to secure food self-sufficiency in the village.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for workforce

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally P. is from the village of Countryhills, Luinab, Iligan City. She is 53 years old. Sally is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Sally operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling used clothing and shoe products in the local community. Sally has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Sally joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Sally from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Luinab, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester O. is 35 years old, single and does not have any children yet. His business is located in Mshomoroni, a residential area in Mombasa. He does carpentry and sells beds and sideboards. He has been in this business for the last two years and has two employees. He sells to local wholesalers and retailers. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is customers not paying their debts on time as per their agreement. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using his loan of KES 80,000 to buy timber, backboard and nails to meet his customers' needs. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He is very hardworking, honest, determined and self-motivated.

loans.use: to buy timber, backboard and nails

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has acquired senior high education. She is married to a builder and has one child. With the support of her husband, she is able to provide for the needs of her family.

Joyce T. has been selling wax print cloth and provisions at Takoradi for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her child’s further education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Phân

texts.en: Phân S. earns a living as a tailor for her neighbors. By doing this, she is able to generate $4 per day to resolve her family's financial crisis. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who is a goldsmith. The couple is married and blessed with three school-aged children. Phân S. owns and uses her vehicle which breaks down frequently, and her transportation has been affected. As she lacks funds, Phân S. has applied for a loan to change her old vehicle.

loans.use: To change her old vehicle

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa P. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Josefa is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josefa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josefa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with two boys, both of whom attend school. Her husband is employed at the Kenya Ports Authority and he provides for the family's needs. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. 

For the last four years, Mishi has operated a food-vending business where schoolchildren and neighbors are her major customers. Mishi faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the months of April and August holidays, schools close, hence, the low turnout of customers. She hopes to open a nice restaurant in the future. 

Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get a loan to improve her business. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to repair her food stall and purchase iron sheets, timber and plywood.
