loans.use: To repair her food stall and purchase iron sheets, timber and plywood

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita A. is from the village of Villaflor. She is 44 years old, married and has 1 adult-aged child. Pacita owns and operates a "sari-sari" store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Pacita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony F. is from the town of Banga. He is 41 years old. Tony is married and has two children aged 17 and 14. To make a living, Tony owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. One of Tony's wishes is to have a God-fearing family. 

Tony joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tony is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase four sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his kids' tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice A. O., 30 years old, is from Kisumu city. She is married to Mathew Opiyo and they have two children aged 14 and 10 years. Eunice has a business selling second-hand clothes at Oile market in Kisumu. She has been doing this for the past two years and is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD. Eunice has a good credit history with us as she paid her first loan without much difficulty. She will use the money to buy five bales of clothes to add to her stock. Profits made from this business will be used for the family’s basic needs. Her desire is to expand her business and be able to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: Buy five  bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Evas

texts.en:
Evas, age 48, is a widow with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Evas is charged with the sole responsibility of looking after her family. She longs be able to provide a good education for her children. 

For two years she has been a poultry keeper, and this has provided her with many benefits, such as building a house for the family. Her business goal is to add more birds to her business and to begin to supply larger areas. Evas is a requesting a loan in order to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To add more chicks in order to supply larger areas

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M. had thought about starting a business for a while.  When she moved to Texas from California, she discovered a niche in the shoe business and jumped on the opportunity.  Her store, Madame Shoe & Accessories, specializes in giving customers a style of merchandise that they love.  During the last year Maria and her husband, Raul, have been busy running the business and raising their 10-month-old.  

Maria and Raul visited several banks to try to take out a loan without success.  The last bank they tried suggested that the couple look into ACCION Texas-Louisiana as another option.  The couple is very excited to receive a loan from ACCION. 
 
The greatest challenge for Maria has been to get the name of the business out into the community.  When customers come in they often say “I didn’t know you guys were here.”  The loan from ACCION is extremely important for the business because it will be used for advertising expenses.  The loan is providing the finances for newspaper ads, flyers, and other types of advertisements.  Maria and her husband hope to bring in many more customers with the boost in advertising.  Maria’s advice to other entrepreneurs is to “take the time and spend the money on advertising” as soon as the business opens.

loans.use: advertising

loans.name: Aunt

texts.en:
Aunt A. D. sells gari (crispy cassava), beans, eggs, corn dough and other food items at Takoradi.  Aunt has received a high school education.  She is divorced and has one child. 

She has been in this trade for two years. She sees to the well-being of her household. The loan will help her expand her business. She will use the loan to buy more food stuffs for sale. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs for sale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. is a 45 years gentleman who is married to Milkah Cheptumo who supports him in the family income. His children are all under 22 years and above two years. He is a farmer and he also runs a retail shop and a butcher shop as his secondary businesses. He has been in these businesses for five years and right now his monthly income is Kshs 12,000.

He is borrowing his first loan of Kshs 15,000 from KADET LTD and he plans to use it as follows; Kshs 5000 to purchase goods for his retail shop and Kshs 10,000 to boost butchery animal stock. 

He hopes to be a prominent business man and to assist his family and the community at large.

loans.use: To boost the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to improve his pig pen

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a mother of one daughter and three sons, Maha and her husband Awny, who appears in the picture here, as Maha is a religious woman, have a small business raising bees and producing honey for sale. Maha and her husband needed more bee cells to increase the production. Maha took a loan from FATEN for this purpose.

Maha and her family live in Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip, which is known for its high population.

loans.use: To purchase bee's cells

loans.name: Juana Maximina

texts.es: JUANA MAXIMINA tiene 35 años de edad es madre soltera con dos hijos de 12 años y uno  de 3 años de edad vive en casa  alquilada hace mas de 2 años se dedica a la venta de pollos hace mas de 10 años tiene un puesto en el mcdo la UNION que pronto sera utilizado para la venta de sus pollos, cuenta cuenta con buenas referencias personales y experiencia crediticia solicita dicho credito para gastos personales se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en: JUANA MAXIMINA, 35, is a single mother of two children who are 12 and 3 years of age living in a rented house.  For over two years she has been selling chicken.  She’s had a stand in the La Union Market for over 10 years that she will start to use to sell chicken soon.  She has good personal references and good credit history.   She is requesting this loan for personal expenses.  It is proposed due to her having ability to pay but above all the willingness to pay.

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito J. is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 52 years old. Carlito is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Carlito owns & operates a business selling a variety of vegetables in the local community. Carlito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Carlito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlito is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carlito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Yeoun

texts.en:
Yeoun S. is married and resides with his family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. provides laundry services, earning an income of USD 3 per day, while his wife sells food, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 100 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to decorate his wife's food stand and repair the motorbike to transport food. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to decorate his wife's food stand and repair the motorbike

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Celedonia has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income by raising livestock.

Celedonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of sending her child to school and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Svay P., 48, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. P. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about USD 1 each per day. Three of her children are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 each per month. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 60 on the other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work.

loans.name: Porfiria Benedicta

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras partes del país.

La señora Porfiria es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos ya que no piden tantos requisitos. Tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  seis hijos, dos fallecieron y los otros ya  son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en un sitio turístico llamado El Badén De la Poza, allí arrienda un local donde prepara deliciosos platos para los turistas que llegan en gran números los fines de semana y los feriados, trabaja sábado, domingo y días feriados, desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde. Trabaja sola.  Nos cuenta que tiene su restaurante por cuatro  años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien y que plato preferido de sus clientes son el caldo y seco de gallina criolla.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, gallinas  y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Sus sueños son tener su propio lugar turístico ya que esto deja muy buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
In the parish Ayacucho of the canton Santa Ana, the Communal Bank Amigas Por Siempre [Friends Forever] meets every two weeks. This place is known for its vegetation but above all for its beautiful sweet water spas. The spas are visited by many local tourists as well as by tourists from other parts of the country.

Porfiria is the founding member of the communal bank. She likes it because of the simplicity of getting loans since they don't require too much. She is 59 years old, is married, and has six children from this relationship. Two have died and the others are older in age and are independent. Her husband works in agriculture.

She has a small restaurant in a tourist site called El Badén de la Poza [The Dip from the Puddle]. There she rents a place where she prepares delicious entrees for the tourists that arrive in great numbers on the weekends and holidays. She works Saturday, Sunday, and holidays from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. She works alone. She tells us that she has had the restaurant for four years and that it has always gone well for her. The entree that her customers order the most is broth and dry Creole chicken.

She is going to use this loan to buy rice, meat, chicken, and other ingredients for the preparation of the food.

Her dreams are to have her own tourist place since it brings in good earnings.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, chickens, and more ingredients for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Marica Lorena

texts.es:
Marcia es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones en su vida por eso es vendedora de ropa y artículos según la temporada.  

Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercial de mercadería y ropa para poder mantener a sus tres hijos. Trabajan en conjunto porque tienen  que viajar a otras provincias para tener un resultado favorable en sus ventas ya que en las provincias se vende más la mercadería.  Venden camisas, pantalones, zapatos. 

Tienes muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando pero por ahora quiere adecuar su casa para darle una buena vida a sus hijos. Por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar cemento, arena, bloques. En el futuro quiere continuar con el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Marcia is a hard-working woman who has a lot of aspirations in life.  Her business is selling clothes and other goods according to the season.

Marcia and her husband sell merchandise and clothes so that they can support their three children.  They work together because they have to travel to other provinces in order to make good sales since their merchandise sells better in the provinces.  They sell shirts, pants and shoes.

Marcia has a lot of aspirations for her business and would like to continue working.  However, right now she would like to do some work on her house so that she can provide her children with a good life.  She would like to use her loan to buy cement, sand and blocks.  In the future, she would like to continue with her family business.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone and sand

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has six dependents. She has received senior high education. Ama sells palm oil, shea butter, powder, soaps and other items by moving from one area to another at Abura, which she has done for 5 years. Her husband is a teacher. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the basic needs of her family. Ama will use the loan to purchase shea butter, powder, and soaps to expand her business.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase shea butter, powder, and soaps to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 43 year-old married woman, mother of four children, living and working in Ain. Fatima has owned a grocery store for three years and is working hard to expand it. That’s why she has requested a fourth loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner in order to continue expanding the shop through building extra rooms. She hopes to become a big supermarket in the future. Her previous loans helped a lot in improving her business, and she is a borrower in good standing. Fatima sells household appliances in addition to food and beverages. She is working hard to make extra space to add new products to her shop, which will increase her family’s income and cover most of their expenses.

loans.use: To continue expanding her shop through building extra rooms, and become a big supermarket

loans.name: Adonaïm 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme Zenabo est la responsable du groupe ADONAÏM2.Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Le plus âgé a 5ans et le moins âgé a 3ans. Aucun ne va à l’école et elle a 2 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des condiments depuis 5ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de pissy en ville. Ses client sont les hommes et les femmes.

Mme veut acheter un sac d’oignon, un carton de patte de tomate, un plat de tomate fraiche, un demi plat de percile et de celerie, 2kg d’ail, un paquet de Maggi.

Elle prend soin de ses enfants avec ses bénéfices. Ses ambitions sont de scolariser ses enfants et d’agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Mrs. Zenabo is manager of the ADONAIM 2 group. She is married and mother of 2 children.  The oldest is 5 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Neither attends school and she has two dependents. She has been selling condiments for 5 years.  She stocks up at the Pissy market in town.  Her customers are men and women.  She wants to buy a bag of onions, a carton of tomato paste, a plate of fresh tomatoes, a half-plate of parsley and celery, 2 kg of garlic, and one package of Maggi seasoning.  She takes care of her children with her profits.  Her goals are to put her children in school and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of onions, a carton of tomato paste, a plate of fresh tomatoes, a half-plate of parsley and celery, 2 kg of garlic, one package of Maggi seasoning.

loans.name: Los Encinos Group

texts.es: La señora Maria es originaria de una localidad llamada La Barranca un lugar hermosos con unos espectaculares paisajes, ella es parte del grupo El Encinal y comenta que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que donde hacen sus reuniones hay muchos árboles de ese árbol llamado encino y es por eso que le pusieron ese nombre. Doña Maria tiene 5 hijos hace poco ella enviudo y ahora esta a cargo de sus pequeños hijos, comenta María que ella se dedica a la cría y venta de borregos y al cultivo de aguacate desde hace 8 años que su esposo y ella decidieron emprender ese negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles una carrera. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar borregos pequeños y ponerlos en engorda y después venderlos en su localidad. También ella se dedica a la venta de aguacate comenta que en temporada de lluvias es cuando mas se le vende y lo puede dar a mejor precio, comenta que de esas ganancias que obtenga ella ahorrara para cómprales a sus pequeños hijos los útiles escolares ya que pronto entraran a un nuevo ciclo escolar. La meta que tiene la señora Maria es salir adelante con sus hijos y hacer una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para estar mas al pendiente de sus niños.
texts.en:
Maria is originally from an area called La Barranca, a beautiful place with spectacular landscapes.  She’s part of a group called El Encinal and she tells us that the members decided to name it that way because there are many oak trees (Encino in Spanish) in the place when they hold their meetings.  Maria has five children and was recently widowed.  She raises sheep and grows avocados and she and her husband had been doing this together for eight years.  They decided to start this business so that they could help their children get ahead and be able to establish careers.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy lambs to raise and sell in her area.  She also sells avocadoes and tells us that she gets the best prices during the rainy season.  It’s from those earnings that she saves up to buy her children’s school supplies, especially now that they are getting ready to begin a new school year.

Maria’s goal is to get ahead with her children and open a small grocery store in her home, so that she can better care for her children.

loans.use: to buy lambs to raise

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 25 years old and married. She has two children aged four and 6. 

Ritchel has been a farmer for five years. She helps her husband till their land located in Banga, South Cotabato. They grow corn and rice crops. According to Ritchel, they earn about 8000 Philippine Peso (PHP) per month from farming. This income helps provide for their needs. 

Ritchel has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides. She hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
Gilberto lives in the Philippines. He is married and is 34 years old.
Gilberto  has a shop that sells pigs & chicken. He also makes and sells wood charcoal. He has been in this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for pigs & chicken.
Gilberto  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gilberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs & chicken

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Gusti Ayu lives in the village of Tegal Cangkring with her husband, who is a farmer, and two children, who are still in elementary school. At the age of 33, she works diligently to develop the piggery at her home in spite of work at the bridal salon that she also has. 

Gusti Ayu has been cooperating with Kiva Field Partner MUK, staying in touch until now, when she can get a loan of 2,000,000 Rupiah (IDR). She and the other members of the Daya Pertiwi loan group are trying to develop their businesses even though the price of pig feed is increasing. With the addition of the current loan Gusti Ayu is hoping to buy 10 piglets and make an additional 500,000 IDR per month. 

Future profits will be used to finance their children's education and to meet the needs of their families, especially groceries.

loans.use: to buy 10 piglets

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es una mujer muy trabajadora que tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad. Ella vive en el municipio de Sabanagrande,  donde tiene un negocio y vende comidas, como sancochos, frituras y pasteles o amasijo envuelto con pitas, en hojas de bijao, preparado con carne, pollo, cerdo, o trifásico, verduras, arroz o  harina. Cuando inició su negocio e el año 2010 solo respondía a unos cuantos encargos de hayacas, como fue muy recomendada por aquellos que la consumían, aumentaron sus pedidos y generando utilidades ha logrado adicionar otras líneas de productos ya mencionadas. En su crecimiento le hace falta ser apoyada con capital de crédito, para lograr compras de materias primas en mayor volumen, ganar descuentos por hacerlo de contado y mejorar el menaje de su negocio . Esta es la razón por la que acude a su credikiva que invertirá en este propósito. Su sueño es tener totalmente adecuado sus instalaciones y gradualmente trabajará fuertemente para conseguirlo. Mientras esto ocurre maneja una capacidad de pago que le permite cumplir las obligaciones de créditos y solventar sus compromisos a corto plazo. Sus ventas son generalmente de contado, razón por la cual rotan rápidamente sus inventarios y desde el análisis y la evaluación de estos indicadores financieros, auguramos su potencial crecimiento y una inversión exitosa la que aplicaría con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking woman who has a one-year-old son. She lives in the town of Sabanagrande, where she has a business selling food such as stews, fritters, and pastry or dough wrapped in either pita bread or banana leaves. These items are prepared with beef, chicken, pork, or a combination of all three, as well as with rice and flour. When she started her business in 2010, she only responded to a few orders for “hallacas” but her food was highly recommended by those who ate it. As a result, her orders increased and she generated more profits by adding other types of dishes that were mentioned earlier. Her business needs the support of operating capital in order to grow. This will allow her to buy raw ingredients in large volumes and with cash so that she can obtain discounts and improve the inventory of her business. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can invest for this purpose.

Her dream is to totally remodel her facilities and she is gradually working hard to achieve this goal. In the meantime, Maribel is managing her cash flow so that she can meet her credit obligations and resolve her short-term commitments. She also has rapid product turnover. Based on the analysis and evaluation of these financial indicators, her Kiva loan should result in a successful investment and an increase in her growth potential.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in large volumes.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
This is Riza, 54, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a truck driver, and mother to their children.  She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Riza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this she also earns additional income from rugs and accessories that she sells. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Riza hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is 58 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger (traditional tent like structure), in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. 

His sons are taxi drivers. His wife sells vegetables at the local market. He started his taxi business in 2004.  Now he and his two sons earn a daily profit.   Their daily income is about 100,000 MNT. 

"Starting next year, my sons will marry and I need to prepare for their weddings and other things," says Batjargal.  

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to redecorate his apartment and to buy a storage house.

loans.use: to redecorate his apartment and buy a storage house.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children: four are still attending school, one has already finished, and the other is still too young for school. Fatuma's husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. They have a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Fatuma's greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Fatuma has operated a goat-selling business for the past year. Her potential clients are the people at the market. Transporting her goats to the market for sale is one of the major challenges she faces. She dreams of expanding her business and selling cattle as well.

With the loan of 40,000 KES, Fatuma wants to purchase more goats to sell. She decided to join Yehu because it cares about its clients' welfare.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale.

loans.name: Angelica Elena

texts.es:
Angelica es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento D. Puno, tiene 52 años D. edad, está separada y tiene siete hijos, seis D. ellos ya son independientes.
	
La señora se dedica a la venta D. artesanía,  bordados, cerámicas D. collares, cadenas, pulseras y ropas D. toda clase, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace tres años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.

Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará bayeta (tela), lanas y bordados.  Nos cuenta que sus productos los venD. en Bolivia, Cusco, y Arequipa.

La señora desea tener más capital para el negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el préstamo D. la cuenta interna y sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of Aymaras Juli II Communal Bank in the district of Juli, province of Chucuito and department of Puno.  She is 52 years old and separated, and has seven children, six of whom are already independent.
	
Angelica works selling handicrafts, embroidery, ceramic necklaces, chains, bracelets, and all types of clothing.  She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for more than three years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 500 PEN, money she invested in her business.

With this new loan of 1500 PEN she will buy fabric, wool, and embroidery.  She tells us that she sells her products in Bolivia, Cusco, and Arequipa.

Angelica wants to have more capital for her business and so improve her earnings.

What she likes about her communal bank are the personal loan and her savings.

loans.use: to buy fabric, wool, and embroidery.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger, tiene la edad  de 25  años, está en unión libre y vive con su esposa  e hija  que son su prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia y la semilla de frijol para sembrarla. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo además de varios años de experiencia y conocimiento sobre los métodos de producción del Frijol. El quiere sembrar un terreno que reúne las condiciones favorables de explotación y asistir la siembra de la mejor manera para obtener un muy buen resultado de esta. El tiene como meta generar el máximo de producción de frijol para la venta y generar bastantes ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia al igual que su nivel económico de viviencia. 

Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Roger, aged 25, is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his wife and daughter, who are his priority in life.  

With the loan, he will purchase supplies to help him with his farming and seeds for planting.  He has a piece of land that is suitable for this type of crop, and several years of experience and knowledge about production methods for beans.  He wants to plant some land that has favorable conditions for cultivation, and to improve the way he does his growing so as to get very good results. 

His goal is to produce as many beans as possible to sell and generate sufficient income to improve his family's quality of life and their financial standard.  

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't taken other loans previously from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to plant and cultivate beans.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en: Mr. Baasansuren, 35, runs a translation bureau in the town of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his son and wife in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar. He has been running his business for five years and still has not been able to increase his income significantly.  Due to this he decided to start a new business selling coal for fuel usage in addition to his translation business. According to his plan, after his new business becomes stable, his income will increased notably after he pays back all debts. Initially he needs enough working capital to stablize his new business. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase the a large amount of coal for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of coal for sale.

loans.name: Mirian Virinia

texts.es:
Mirian de 54 años, una mujer que vive con su mama que es un señora de edad, para la cual trabaja vendiendo productos de uso propio, Trabaja sola y todos los días sale a recorrer casa para poder vender sus productos.

Su meta es poder ponerse un bazar en su casa para que así pueda estar descansando un poco y también generar más ingresos para poder ayudar a su madre.
texts.en:
Mirian is 54 years old. She lives with her mother who is an older woman. Miriam works selling personal care products. She works alone and every day she goes out from house-to-house in order to sell her products.

Her goal is to be able to open a boutique in her home so that she can rest a bit and also generate more income to assist her mother.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions and makeup.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral y además vende bebidas en su casa (gaseosas, jugos) así como productos de primera necesidad, ella vive con su esposo, el negocio de la crianza de animales la aprendió en su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, como aceite, arroz, azúcar, café, huevos, embutidos, y otros que fortalecerán el negocio, ya que podrá mejorar la disponibilidad para su clientela.
La aspiración de ella es seguir creciendo y en un futuro establecer un negocio mayor y ser buena cliente.
texts.en:
Lucia raises fowl and also sells drinks from her home (sodas and juices) along with other basic groceries. She lives with her husband. She learned animal husbandry from her family.

Currently she requests a loan to buy basic groceries like oil, rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, sausages and other things that will strengthen her business by helping her to meet the needs of her customers.

Her goal is to keep growing and one day have a larger business and good customers.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, coffee, eggs and sausages.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. Genoveva has a shop that makes and sells homemade ice cream. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 pesos to buy raw ingredients needed for making ice cream. Genoveva has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genoveva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making ice cream

loans.name: Ndiaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de quatre enfants.Elle exerce l'activité de commerce de sacs, de tissus et d'articles de mercerie.Son activité est très rentable et lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et de participer activement à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Pour renforcer son commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000f pour acheter des tissus, des parfums et des sacs.Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman and mother to four children. 

She runs as a business a shop selling bags, fabric and haberdashery items. Her business is very profitable and allows her to meet her needs and to actively participate in taking care of family expenses. 

To strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of 100,000f to buy fabric, perfume and bags. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, perfume and bags.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Battamabang Province, Moung Russey district is a place in which farming is common. It is the hometown of Keo, who is the mother of four children, three of whom are still in school. She has been working on rice farming for fifteen years as a primary source of income. However, to support her big family, she also works at molding pillars for houses and as a wedding cook for secondary income.

Keo has been with VisionFund for three years. The past loan has provided her family with a better living and managed to get them through the hardships during flooding. She is now requesting another loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline. She will use a portion to fix her rice milling machine.

She hopes to produce more healthy rice and get more income to support her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 49 years-old and lives in Pta. Sulong, Baliangao. She is married with two children. 

Marieta works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 29 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 in order to purchase more fish to sell. 

Marieta has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 59 years old and lives in Rizal, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children.

Lorna has a general store that sells a variety of products including soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many other items.  She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 14,900 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more stock for her general store.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. She hopes to have a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise up her business.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila is 57, married,and has 4 children.She lives in  Khaladj village, Salyan region.  
She has her own poultry farm in the backyard of her house and she checks and attends the animals daily. 
Every day Nazila goes to the market and stores to offer her products. She has had her business for 15 years ago and it allows her to support her family.
Having borrowed $500 she bought 100 chickens. 
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 200 chickens.

loans.use: To buy 200 chickens

loans.name: Oli

texts.en: Oli P. operates her own flea market where she sells her own handicrafts as well as traditional clothing such as puletasi (ladies' dresses) and t-shirts for men. The Christmas season is a very exciting period for Oli, because this is a big time of the year when more tourists visit Samoa.  They always buy handicrafts made in Samoa to take it back with them as a souvenir. Some Samoan people who live outside of Samoa also buy a lot of handicrafts when they return to their country of residence. Oli makes a weekly profit of ST$400 (approximately USD160), which helps in supporting her big family and also in paying for her children's education.  She is now applying for another loan to buy more handicrafts for her business.

loans.use: Purchase more handicrafts to sell at the flea market

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa L. is forty-three years old, married with four children. The children are all in school. Her husband is also a petty trader selling rice, salt, and tomato paste in the market.

Hawa sells jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, and locally made beads. She started her business five years ago but could not expand it due to lack of capital. She then joined SMT.

Hawa would like to access a larger loan from SMT to purchase quality jewelry from the Republic of Guinea. She has many customers who are interested in better quality jewelry. She feels that with better quality, she would be able to earn more profit and improve her family's life.

loans.use: Improve the quality of her jewelry stock

loans.name: Teodosa Laudina

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Teodora Laudina. My main job is sales. I have a small business selling clothing and cosmetics, which is located in my house, that allows me to generate income and contribute to paying my family’s expenses. Currently sales are good, for which reason I need to invest in inventory. I don’t have sufficient capital to satisfy my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Teodosa Laudina, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y Cosmeticos, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante. tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me permite generar ingresos y contribuir con los gastos de mi familia. Actualmente el volumen de venta es mayor por lo que necesito mayor inversión y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer a los clientes.

loans.use: To buy deodorant, lotion, shampoo, women's undergarments, and blouses

loans.name: Nivia

texts.en:
Nivia is 54 years old and has four children and five grandchildren. She is married, and five of her children/grandchildren live with her at home. Her husband is an agricultural worker at a local farm.

Nivia runs a small chicken farm. She raises some to sell for their meat and others to sell their eggs. With the earnings from her small business, she is able to supplement her family’s income.

Nivia took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 5th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other 4. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow increasingly larger amounts. Nivia is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

With her new loan she wants to increase the number of chickens she can raise to sell.

loans.use: To be able to raise more chickens to sell for meat or as layer-hens

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Description of Business

Rosaura offers typical dishes from the coastal region of Ecuador in her small restaurant. She runs her business every day from 7am until 9pm.

Use of Loan

She is requesting the loan to make necessary repairs to her small restaurant, and to buy new utensils for her business. With this she will be able to provide better service to her customers and take advantage of the holiday season.

Personal Information

Rosaura is 36 years old and has 4 children, 3 of them are in school. Her husband is a traveling merchant and he he helps her with the restaurant. Her experience selling meals motivated her to open her own business 5 years ago, utilizing a space in her house to set up her restaurant. Her goal is to be able to grow her business and increase her income.

Descripción del Negocio

Rosaura en su negocio se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y platos de comida típica de la región costa del ecuador. La atención de su negocio lo realiza todos los días de 7am.a 9pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Rosaura solicita el crédito para realizar arreglos de su local y comprar nuevos implementos para su negocio. Para de esta manera mejorar la atención a sus clientes y aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.

Información Personal

Rosaura tiene 36 años de edad, 4 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando. El esposo es comerciante ambulante y la apoya en su negocio de comedor. La experiencia en el comercio la animo en iniciar su propio negocio hace 5 años de venta de comida. Su local cual utiliza un espacio de su vivienda. Su aspiración es lograr crecer junto a su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: TO MAKE NECESSARY REPAIRS AND BUY UTENSILS NEEDED FOR HER RESTAURANT, IMPROVING THE SERVICE SHE CAN OFFER HER CUSTOMERS, GROWING HER BUSINESS, AND INCREASING HER INCOME.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: I am Nasreen S.. I am married and a mother of six: five girls and one son. All of them attend school except the youngest, who is not of school-going age yet. I embroider clothes on order and my husband runs an irons business. He paints the body of these irons. Now he requires a loan of $175 to buy paints in bulk for the business.

loans.use: Buy paint in bulk for the business

loans.name: Thi Hoi

texts.vi:
Mrs Hồi is 34. She sells sticky rice cake and and raises poultry to make ends meet. She is a widow so raising 2 children by herself is quite difficult. She makes 50000-80000 VND/day (3-5 USD/day). She has never borrowed money before. So when she learns of Binh Minh cdc (SEDA), she applies for a loan of 2006000 VND (150 USD) to buy ingredients for the rice cake.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hồi, 34 tuổi, làm nghề bán bánh tẻ và chăn nuôi. Chồng mất sớm, một mình chị nuôi 2 con ăn học, cuộc sống khá vất vả. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị từ 50000-80000đ/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Được biết tới hình thức trả góp hàng tuần của chương trình Tài chính vi mô binh minh cdc, chị rất thích và đã vay 2006000đ để thêm vốn lấy hàng

loans.use: buy ingredients to make rice cake

loans.name: Tsitsopé

texts.fr:
Tsitsopé A. (the woman dressed in a red knit top) is single and 23 years old. For two years, she has been the owner of a hair salon located adjacent to the Adeta marketplace. She professionally manages the salon and accommodates a large number of customers. With the present loan, she is thinking of buying a hair dryer and a big mirror. She is also thinking of making her salon more pleasant for more immediate customer satisfaction.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Tsitsopé A. (femme habillée en tricot rouge)est célibataire,âgée d 23ans, propriétaire d’un salon de coiffure sis à côté du marché d’Adéta depuis deux ans. Elle gère ce salon avec professionnalisme et accueille un grand nombre de clientes. Avec le présent crédit elle pense acheter un séchoir, un grand miroir et rendre plus agréable son salon afin de satisfaire plus rapidement sa clientèle

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and a mirror to bolster her salon's business capacity

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Like other women in Kormasilai village, Sarah grows rice, the main staple food crop, in addition to vegetables.

Sarah is very happy with the agricultural loan program that was introduced late last year by Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT). With her loan, Sarah hired labourers and purchased fertilizer and vegetable seeds. Sarah harvested 60% more rice than before and her vegetable harvest also increased by 40%. Thus encouraged, Sarah is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 to expand her farm so that it can produce enough crops and vegetables to support her family and provide them with a sufficient income.

loans.use: To expand her farm

loans.name: Tamarindo 3 Group

texts.es:
Irma is 32 years old and has five children. Two years ago she started a business from home, a grocery store where she offers sugar, salt, pastas, cookies and soft drinks to the general public. She buys her goods in a nearby town, Ixtapa, which is located 30 minutes from her town. She belongs to the "Tamarindo 3" Solidarity Group, along with Julia Pérez Pérez (sale of clothing) and Juana Pérez González (sale of food typical of the region, tamales). With their loans, they will buy goods so they can expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

IRMA TIENE 32 AÑOS DE EDAD Y TIENE CINCO HIJOS. HACE DOS AÑOS INICIO UN NEGOCIO EN SU CASA, TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN DONDE OFRECE AL PUBLICO EN GENERAL AZUCAR, SAL, PASTAS, GALLETAS, REFRESCOS. SU MERCANCIA LO ADQUIERE EN EL PUEBLO MAS CERCANO, IXTAPA UBICADO A 30 MINUTOS DE SU LOCALIDAD. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO TAMARINDO 3 JUNTO CON SUS COMPAÑERAS JULIA P. P. (VENTA DE ROPA) Y JUANA P. G. (VENTA DE COMIDA TIPICA DE SU LOCALIDAD, TAMALES). CON SUS PRESTAMOS ADQUIRIRAN MERCANCIA PARA AMPLIAR SUS NEGOCIOS.

loans.use: Purchase goods for their businesses.

loans.name: Apate Jean

texts.fr:
Apate Jean B. is 41 years old, married, and has children. He lives and works in Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. To provide for his family's needs, he operates a business painting cars. With this loan, he wishes to buy a lot of paint of various colors to have variety in his work. He hopes that, with this improvement, he can capture more customers, earn more money, and increase the quality of life.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Apate Jean B. est âgé de 41 ans et marié avec des enfants. Il habite et travaille à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille il opère un commerce de peinture auto. Avec ce crédit, il souhaite acheter beaucoup de peint des couleurs variées pour varier son produit. Il espère qu’avec cette amélioration il peut attraper plus des clients, gagner plus d’argent et augmenter la qualité de la vie.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 37 years old. She is married with 3 children, who are currently in school. She is a trader who deals in cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets, and plates. She balances her stock on her head and moves to the doorsteps of her customers, popularly known as hawking. This is very tiring and neck breaking. Diana is an achiever, and her focus is to build a container shop from her savings to enable her to have a station for her sales. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She is a member of the community group called Blessing Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and use peer pressure to repay the loans. Diana’s photograph was taken during her group meeting, and she is very alert in the photo.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
In order to bring more income to his family Elvis began to cultivate coffee; in the jungle area where he lives it is very profitable and there are great alternatives for growth. Now, Elvis hopes that his coffee is ready to be sold in the city, so that with his profit he can begin preparing for the next planting. His desire is to expand his crops and thus he is applying for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of plants and materials for his next round of coffee production.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Elvis, con el fin de traer un ingreso económico más a su familia, empezó a cultivar café, ya que en la zona de selva donde vive, es muy rentable y tiene grandes alternativas de crecimiento.Ahora, Elvis espera que su café esté listo para ser vendido en la ciudad, para que con las ganancias pueda prepararse para la próxima producción. El deseo de este joven, es de ampliar sus cultivos.Para ello, solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de las plantas e insumos necesarios para su próxima producción de café.

loans.use: Investment capital for his next round of coffee production

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Historia

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Roshan

texts.en:
Roshan is a 45-year-old woman. She is married with 4 children. She is a seamstress and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Roshan's husband has a meager salary. He works in a private company but she must work hard at her business to help her family.

She needs money for her business so she has requested an individual loan to buy new machines, etc. for sewing and complete her stock. She will work hard and take a shop because now she is working out of her home. She wants to enlarge her business to make a good monthly income for her family. Roshan is happy with this process of loans. She wants to continue her business and this loan will allow her to do so. She would like to thank lenders who help poor people around this world.

loans.use: To buy new machines for tailoring

loans.name: Asha's Group

texts.en:
Asha has been selling charcoal and firewood in Zanzibar for two years. Because she serves her local community, she does not have strict opening and closing hours. Instead, her clients are free to seek her out at any time of the day or night to purchase firewood and charcoal from her. She currently earns approximately $45 in profit each month but she is hopeful that by expanding her inventory with this loan, her profit will increase.

Asha is 47 years old, divorced, and has four children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Rahma, who also has a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: 21 De Enero Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "21 D. ENERO", ESTÁN REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEÑORA ELIANA, EXISTEN PARENTESCOS ENTRE EL GRUPO PRESENTAN  COMO NEXO CONSANGUÍNEO ENTRE LAS SEÑORAS GABRIELA, LAURA, CARMEN  Y ELIODORA REYNALDO Y ELIANA ELLOS SON HERMANOS PERO CON INGRESOS INDEPENDIENTES LO QUE NO OCASIONA PROBLEMAS EN EL GRUPO. LAS SOCIAS DESARROLLAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES, COMO PROMOTORAS D. COSMÉTICOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES, D. MASITAS Y VENTA D. COMIDA, SE PRESENTA EN EL BANCO SOCIAS QUE PRESTAN SUS SERVICIOS PROFESIONALES D. FORMA INDEPENDIENTE. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA EL CRÉDITO QUE SE LES OTORGÓ, SEGÚN EXPRESIONES D. LAS SOCIAS ESTA DESTINADO PARA INCREMENTAR SU MERCADERÍA Y COMPRAR HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO.EFECTIVAMENTE LAS SOCIAS COMENTAN QUE YA TUVIERON CRÉDITOS ANTERIORES  POR LO QUE TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN EL TRABAJO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS.SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y MUY CUMPLIDAS YA QUE ALGUNAS YA TUVIERON LA OPORTUNIDAD D. TRABAJAR CON AGROCAPITAL.
texts.en:
The members of the “21 D. Enero” microfinance institute are represented by Ms. Eliana. Some peope in the group are related. Gabriela, Laura, Carmen, Eliodora, Reynaldo, and Eliana are all siblings. However, they all have their own income, which does not create problems in the group. The members partake in different business activities, such as cosmetics, general stores, petit fours and food sales, etc. Members who proviD. independent professional services turn up at the microfinance institute. As in any commercial realm, there is always competition with supply and demand. According to the members, the loan will be used to increase their merchandise and purchase work tools. Indeed, the members say that they have previously received loans, which means that they have experience working in solidarity. They are very responsible people because some of the members have already had the opportunity to work with Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Dương Thị K. năm nay 44  tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện nay chị là chủ cửa hàng làm đầu, chăm sóc sắc đẹp cho phụ nữ còn chồng chị  sửa chữa đồ điện gia dụng tại nhà. Với mức thu nhập hàng tháng đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng công việc kinh doanh và cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn  được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm trang thiết bị mở rộng cửa hàng.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. Thi Duong, 44 years old, has been participating in the fund since 2007. Currently, she is the owner of a beauty salon for women and her husband is an electrical repairman working out of their home. With an income of 4,000,000 VND per month, her family's finances are becoming increasingly stable and her family's quality of life is improving day by day. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying more equipment to expand her salon.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more equipment

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha V. is a villager in Boeng Veng Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns 8 hectares where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her fields are infertile which is bad for her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Pha V. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the fields. She plans to use the rest of the loan to hire laborers to work on the fields.

Mrs. Pha V. is a widow with four children, two of whom help her in the plantation while another one is a construction worker and the remaining one is a grocer.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the fields

loans.name: Carmen Pilar

texts.es:
Carmen estudió Arte Femenino en Lima, de donde aprendió todo lo relacionado con la confección. Su negocio es confección de ropa y arreglo de prendas. Aparte ofrece servicios de teléfono público. 

Para realizar su trabajo actual solo dispone de una máquina semi-industrial y en un futuro le gustaría poder invertir en capital para ampliar su taller. En este momento está usando el préstamo para reforzar la construcción de su casa.

Carmen se beneficia de los préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace tres años, y ha estado trabajando en su negocio desde hace ocho años. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de artesanías. 
A los cincuenta y siete años es viuda, y aunque sus hijos ya no viven con ella, tiene a su cargo a su nieto, así que sus ganancias las utiliza para cubrir los gastos de la crianza del niño y la mejora de su situación de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen studies Feminine Art in Lima, where she has learned everything related to making it. Her business is making clothing and repairing it. She also offers services with a public telephone. In order to do her work, she has arranged for one semi-industrial machine, and in the future she would like to be able to invest in capital to increase her factory. At the moment she would use the loan to reinforce the construction of her home. Carmen has benefited from loans from EDAPROSPO for the past three years, and has worked at her business for the past 8 years. Before she worked selling crafts. At 56 years of age she is a widow, and although she has children they don’t live with her. She has in her care a nephew, and so her income is used to cover the expenses of raising the boy and to improve her situation in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial construction of her home

loans.name: Olinda Geronima

texts.es:
Compró lana para sus tejidos.
Olinda, aunque está casada y comparte sus gastos con su esposo, se dedica a varios negocios para tener bastante ingresos para cubrir los expendios de su hogar y de la cría de los niños que tiene a cargo – sus dos hijos y una sobrina. 
Principalmente se ocupa de tejido manual de prendas y chompas, y de compra y venta de productos lácteos. Los dos los empezó recién, hace 6 meses. Los tejidos aprendió a hacerlos trabajando en una fábrica, donde tiene un empleo inestable desde hace dos años, y los produce comprando ella misma los materiales. El negocio de la compra y venta de quesos y otros productos lácteos se le ocurrió porque su madre y su padre son ganaderos en la selva, y de allí ella puede conseguir unos buenos productos naturales que mucha gente prefiere a los industriales que se encuentran mayormente en la zona.
Además Olinda apoya en el comedor de su comunidad desde hace ocho años, junto a otras mujeres de su Alcancía Comunal y compañeras de su trabajo de tejido.
Recién empezó a sacar los préstamos con EDAPROSPO, hace unos meses, y a sus cuarenta y ocho años le gustaría en un futuro poder abrir una bodega en su casa para tener un lugar fijo donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
She purchased yarn for her knitting. Olinda, although married and sharing the expenses with her husband, dedicates herself to various businesses to generate enough income to cover the costs of the home and raising the children in her care – her two children and one niece. Primarily, she occupies herself making hand-knitted clothes and sweaters, and in the purchase and sale of dairy products. She started both endeavors recently, only about six months ago. She learned how to make her knitwear working in a factory, where she has worked sporadically for the past two years. She makes her products by buying the raw materials herself. The business involving buying and selling cheeses and other dairy products occurred to her because her mother and father are jungle ranchers. From them, she can obtain a variety of good, natural products that many people prefer to those that are manufactured such as those found primarily in her zone. In addition, Olinda has helped out at the dining hall of her community for the past eight years, along with other women of the township and workmates from her knitting job. Recently, only two months ago, she started taking loans with EDAPROSPO. At 48 years of age, she would like to in the future be able to open a general store in her home to have a fixed location from which to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yarn for her knitwear.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia owns a small charcoal store and call center in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She belongs to Mjimwema "A" group loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for her business. She hopes that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business, so she can pay school fees for her child and get more food for her family.  

Sophia is 44 years old, married, and has five children, ages 29, 26, 24, 17 and 13.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 52-year-old divorced mother of five children. She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel, which is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries. Victoria produces and supplies palm kernel oil to local food vendors. She also sells Fanti kenkey and homemade loaves of bread. She has been in this business for five years now.  Her production is low because she does not have the capital to buy a processing machine and does everything manually.  She wants to use the loan to buy seventy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine to help produce her oil in larger quantities. She believes the loan will enable her to save more money toward her children's educations. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua Kuo’ which means God’s family.

loans.use: To buy seventy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria is 55 years old and resides in Barangay San Roque Centro Enrile, Cagayan with her loving family. She is married to Arcelino, who is also her business partner. She has seven children, of which few are married, while others are still studying. Daria is doing her best to earn a living to support her children’s education and to improve her living conditions. 

She currently makes income by buying and selling recyclable materials such as empty cans, bottles, plastics, aluminums and so on. Aside from this, she also sells meat and fish in her village as an alternate source of income. For the development of her business, Daria requests a loan of PHP 10,000. The loan will not only be of great help in assisting her children’s education but also in improving her business and, through the income from her business, she can fulfill her dream of renovating her house.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en:
L. Ngo Thi is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising cattle for sale. L. has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. L. is now requesting a loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock. This loan will be her ninth loan from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. No. 9280108882

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Z. Gladys is a very hard working business woman, 45 years old and married with four children. She has a Tailoring Business in her own house and she has a cow too. She is using the loan to purchase more clothes to fulfill customer demands and increase her business stock. Her dream is to work hard and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Камолов Абдулмумин проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. По специальности работал колхозником, более 30 лет. В данный момент занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливанием и продажей скота. Этим видом бизнеса занимается 6 лет. клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить мелко-рогатый скот.
texts.en:
Abdulmumin K. lives in the Rumy region. He is 47 years old. He is married and has 6 children. He worked in his profession as a collective farmer for more than 30 years. Right now he raises livestock; he fattens and sells livestock. He has been in this business for 6 years. The client is asking for a loan to purchase small-horned livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis T. is 29 years old. She is married and is the mother of a child who is still breastfeeding. All her children are currently in school. She lives with her children at Sefwi Dwinase in the western region of Ghana.

Mavis is a baker and bakes bread to supply to her loyal customers. For the past seven years till now, she is been baking bread and other food pastries in order to take care of her household. In spite of the challenges she faces she manages to handle the demands of her customers and successfully meet their requests on time.

Mavis’s only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and save more for future eventualities. She said your help is much needed in her life and business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood

loans.name: Benkadi 2 De Toura Nabitokan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 2 est composé de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles ont comme pratique  agricole la culture  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 2 de Toura  Nabitokan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 2  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 2 group is made of married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 48 years of age, and have at least 4 children. Their farming businesses consist in growing peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 2 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 2 group count on turning a profit of XOF 25000 to 20000 (ca US$ 55 to 45) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Melma

texts.en:
Melma D. is a rice grower and a mother of two children. She dreams of improving her business and buying another farm. Currently, she has an almost two hectare rice field and 2 carabaos. She said that she just had her planting last week. Now, she is a bit worried about where to get money to buy fertilizer to improve the soil condition.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Community economic Ventures Inc (CEVI). She will use the money to purchase 2 sacks of Urea, rice seeds, and other farm inputs.

She really appreciates CEVI's efforts in serving poor people like her. She said in CEVI everybody is able to pay their loans because it has the lowest interest rates. She also said that aside from loans, CEVI also gives insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Group

texts.es: La asociación “Nueva Generación”, trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace un año, se reúnen cada dos semanas en el centro focal Villa Exaltación, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. Los negocios de este grupo son variados, algunas se dedican al tejido, otras de ellas venden frutas, mochilas, conservas, dulces y confeccionan  calzados, entre otros. Todas afirman que necesitan créditos para la compra de materia prima y/o mercaderia.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA Y/O MERCADERIA

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike is 32 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and frozen foods. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen foods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine R. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Christine bought and has just started running a general store where she sells a variety of different products to the local community.

In 2007, Christine joined PMPC to gain access to their financial services. Christine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Christine is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and obtain working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Christine from PMPC. She plans to use her profits to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory and obtain working capital

loans.name: Mercedes Adilia

texts.es: Doña Mercedes Adilia es pequeña comerciante del sector de La Libertad, Chontales, ha cancelado 4 creditos en los que ha demostrado excelente conducta de pago, actualmente solicita el 5to credito para continuar mejorando su vivienda, pues necesita levantar las paredes internas de su casa y ponerle el piso y si el credito lo permite cambiar el techo de la casa que se encuentra en mal estado y de esta manera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que asume los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Doña Mercedes Adilia is a small businesswoman who works in the region of La Libertad, Chontales. She completed 4 previous loans in which she demonstrated an excellent payment history. Doña Mercedes is now requesting a 5th loan to continue improvements to her home. She needs to raise the inside walls of her house and install a floor. If there is enough money left over, she will replace the roof because it is in poor condition. Through this loan, she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and support her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise the internal walls, install a floor, and replace the roof

loans.name: Marta Gladys

texts.es: Marta Gladys C. M. reside en el departamento de La Libertad, Marta tiene 51 años de edad vive son su esposo, su hijo y su madre. Hace seis años Marta se dedica a su propio negocio, en cual recibe toda la ayuda y apoyo de su esposo, Marta elabora diariamente variedad de antojitos típicos para ser comercializados con su clientes, posee una gran demanda en sus productos, por sus deliciosos antojitos que ofrece, ella solicita de un crédito con el cual pueda incrementar la producción de sus antojitos y si mejoran sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marta Gladys C. M. is 51 years old and lives with her husband, her son, and her mother in the La Libertad department. For the last 6 years Marta has had her own food preparation business for which she enjoys her husband's full support and help. Marta daily makes a variety of typical dishes which she sells to her customers. Her products are in high demand because her snacks are so delicious. She is requesting funds to buy raw materials so that she can produce more items thereby improving her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es:
La socia YONNY pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 43 años de edad, es divorciada, tiene tres hijos (dos varones y una mujer). Los mayores estudian en la universidad y el menor estudia en el jardín. Ella tiene un pequeño taller de corte y confección de ropa.   

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de costura y hace manualidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de manualidades como arreglos navideños. Ella quiere compran más materiales para su taller de corte y confección de ropa.          .
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yonny is a member of the "Minibank" communal bank and is a native of the city of Cuzco. She is 43 years old, divorced and has three children (two male and one female). The adults study at the university and the minor studies in school. Yonny has a small seamstress and clothesmaking shop. She balances her home life with sewing and handicrafts. She is requesting the loan in order to increase production of handicrafts for sale, such as Christmas arrangements. She wants to buy more materials for her seamstress and clothesmaking shop. She feels grateful for the opportunity granted to her through this medium and thus is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make Christmas arrangements.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly S., 34, lives in a Habitat for Humanity village at the heart of a former slum community in BASECO, Port Area, Manila.  Her husband, Reynaldo, also 34, works for a construction firm.  They have three children, two in grade school.
 
Beverly owns a sari-sari (general) store, which she opened two years ago.  Her profits fulfill the family’s basic daily needs.  She also is able to save some money for her children’s education.  She now earns more than P13,000 a month.  

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in late 2007, and has enjoyed the camaraderie of her fellowship group since then.  Beverly is now on her fifth loan cycle.  She has finished repaying a loan of P10,000 and she has applied for a new loan of P12,000 to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

Beverly dreams of seeing her children to finish their schooling.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell at her store

loans.name: Santos Esmeralda

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Esmeralda Z. I. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en la colonia Villanueva, tiene una pequeña pulperia, su negocio tiene 3 años de estar funcionando, anteriormente Santos trabajaba en una empresa estatal, pero como ya esta de edad decidio retirarse del trabajo y poner su propio negocio para pasar en su casa descanzando y atendiendo a sus clientes. dice sentirse mejor de salud en estos momentos.
este negocio le a generado ingresos para poder cubrir con algunos gastos del hogar, ya que con su esposo se comparten dichos gastos.
