Santos tiene los deseos de ampliar mas su negocio, su negocio cada dia va creciendo mas y siente que ya no le ajusta el espacio fisico para poner toda su mercaderia, es por tal razon que Santos necesita el credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos Esmeralda Z. I. is 51 years old and lives in the Villanueva neighborhood. She has had a small grocery store for three years. Previously, Santos worked for a state company. Since she’s getting old, she decided to retire and open her own business to be able to stay home, be more relaxed and attend to her customers. She has been feeling healthier. This business has provided the income to be able to cover some of the household expenses that she shares with her husband. Santos wants to expand her business. It’s growing on a daily basis and she feels the space is too small for all her merchandise. This is the reason Santos is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Salote

texts.en:
Salote S. is 52 and married with 9 children (ages 18 - 36).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Salote has many years of experience in this business.  Salote needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 700 tala or US $292 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Salote joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Salote's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Salote S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Market Vendors Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Sentongo is a hardworking and determined lady. She is a businesswoman who's been selling beverages and agricultural produce from Lugazi central market for over 15 years. She is grateful that her business has improved greatly over the years. N. is able to make 70,000/= weekly profit and this helps to take care of her expenses including paying school fees for her five children with the help of her husband. Her children are at the university and in secondary school. She also helps to take care of her siblings. 

N. needs a loan to buy more farm produce to sell including greens, tomatoes, cabbages, cassava, sweet potatoes and so on.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce for resale

loans.name: Neim

texts.en: Mrs. Neim S. is 54 years old. She lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5- hectare field used to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Rim Tom, is a construction worker. In order to support her husband's workplace, Mrs. Neim S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband's transportation and to pay the expense for her crop. Mrs. Neim S. is a mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker while another one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha, de 38 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Belisario (38), quien se dedica a la agricultura, y de sus 2 hijos: Clisman (13) y Franklin (10).
Desde que era muy pequeña, esta trabajadora mujer, se dedica a la agricultura; en la actualidad siembra maíz, alverja y papa. Le gusta mucho su labor de campo porque ya está acostumbrada a despertarse muy temprano y dirigirse a vigilar sus cultivos, pues sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación puede producir en abundancia. Además, tiene clientes fijos en los mercados que le compran toda su producción y esto le genera buenas ganancias, que junto con su esposo, pueden brindarles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. 
Y como es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene pensado para el futuro sembrar en mayor cantidad para que pueda vender más.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que será puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere defraudar a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito, el cual le ayudará a progresar. Bertha tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de semillas de alverja y papa, así como fertilizantes y abono para el cuidado de sus tierras, para que no tenga ningún problema en la próxima cosecha .
texts.en:
Bertha is 38 years old and lives with her husband, Belisario (38), in their own home. He is a farmer and they have two children, Clisman (13) and Franklin (10). Since she was very young, Bertha has been farming and a very hard worker. She currently raises corn, peas, and potatoes. She likes working in the fields because she is used to rising early in the morning and going out to care for her crops. She knows that with some work and dedication, she can produce large harvests. She also has regular customers who buy her entire harvest in the marketplaces. This brings her a good income and she and her husband are able to give a good life to their children. Since she is a hard working woman, she plans to increase her planting so that she can increase her sales. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is certain that she will be able to make her payments on time. She does not want to defraud those people who make this loan possible and who help her to get ahead. She plans to use the money from this loan to buy seed for peas and potatoes, as well as fertilizers to help maintain her land, so that she will not have any problems with her next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. is currently in the business of selling sodas at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of sodas to sell.  Christine is 33 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a depot for crates of sodas.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. 

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more crates of sodas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena A. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Iligan City. She is 42 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rowena owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old and widowed with two children who go to school.  She runs a cafeteria in her residential home to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya her business has grown since she can access loans. She has a good customer base due to her good customer care skills. 

Alice mostly cooks delicious African dishes which the home area residents are used to.  She has requested a loan of  20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy utensils and cooking ingredients. She hopes to grow her business and stabilize her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy utensils and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily V. is a 42-year-old mother of four children. She is a native of the Talim Island in the town of Binangonan, which is located in the Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is happily living with her children and her 44-year-old husband Mario who is a fish vendor.

Emily dreams of escaping the spiral of poverty. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines in 2006 with hope of having access to capital to start a business. She and her husband used to be partners in their retail business but as they grew older it become increasingly tiring and laborious. So four years ago when Emily received her first loan from ASHI, she constructed a fish cage in the lake. Since then her business has continued to grow and provide additional income for her family. Emily now requests her sixth loan for 30,000 pesos to use as additional capital for her fish cage business. The loan will be used to pay for more fingerlings.

Emily is looking forward to increased demand for fish on the island so her business will grow and generate enough income for her family. She dreams of sending her four children to school until they finish college.

loans.use: To buy fingerlings

loans.name: Zayda

texts.en:
Zayda F. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Zayda owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services to local community members using her motorcycle. This is the main livelihood of her family, and its daily operations are overseen by Zayda's husband. Zayda has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Zayda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is now requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP. It will be used  to purchased brand new tires for her motorcycle, which is crucial to her transport service. This will be Zayda’s 5th loan taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new motorcycle tires

loans.name: Edda Del Socorro

texts.es: Edda es una mujer muy luchadora que le ha gustado diversificar su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y cosméticos, pues no solamente esta experiencia ha obtenido con estos negocios ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, pues  vive en una pequeña comunidad rural, pues e ha iniciado de forma muy especial debido a la necesidad de sufragar gastos en su familia. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima necesaria como cuadernos, lápices, borradores, reglas papel y cosméticos. Sueña con ampliar su actividad que es lo más importante que tiene.
texts.en:
Edda is a very hard-working woman who has liked to diversify her business. She sells school supplies and cosmetics, but this business is not the only way she has gained experience. Previously, she sold clothing. She lives in a small, rural community, so she has had to be creative in order to cover her family's expenses. She requests this loan in order to purchase necessary materials like notebooks, pencils, erasers, ruled paper, and cosmetics. She dreams of expanding her business, which is the most important thing she has.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials like notebooks, pencils, erasers, ruled paper, and cosmetics

loans.name: Boukari

texts.en: Madame S. Boukari is 27 years old and works selling shoes. She sells her shoes at the Agoe Market where she's worked since 2007. Madame Boukari is married to another merchant, and they have two children. She is requesting her second loan, of 500,000 West African CFA francs, from WAGES in order to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
28-year-old Karen P. is a loving mother to her only offspring and a helpful child to her parents. Despite having her own family to take care of after her marriage to a 33-year-old man name Reynaldo, Karen still wants to support the needs of her parents who are old and poor.

In the light of this, and with the addition of her dream of graduating her child from college in the future, Karen wanted to start her own business to augment the income of her husband who is a hired small-time technician.

Just recently, Karen joined ASHI to request a loan that she will use as capital investment to start up a sari-sari store business. A sari-sari (variety) store basically sells small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. “Sari” is a word in the native dialect of Antiquenos meaning “variety”. This is just a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far away from the owner’s house. Items sold through this business bring convenience to people in the village, especially those who live far away from the town proper where the market is located.

With ASHI and the services she can obtain through her membership, Karen is hopeful that, one day, the kind of life her family has will be comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, foodstuffs, and beverages for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina R. is from the town of Trento. She is 53 years old. Cristina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also manages a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells basic food and daily-need products. Cristina has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Cristina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and additional store inventory. This will be the second loan taken out by Cristina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and additional store inventory

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old married with twelve children. From farming, he accumulated savings which he used to start up his barber shop. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, where he owns a house in which he lives with his family. He dreams of educating his children.

James wants a loan to buy hairdryers and lotion in order to expand his salon from men only to unisex. This will enable him to serve both male and female clients and, in the process, increase his sales. However, his business is affected by the high cost of fuel.

loans.use: To buy hairdryers and lotion

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla O. is from the town of Trento. She is 40 years old. Perla is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Perla joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Perla is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Perla from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en: Annastacia W. M. is 39 years old, single and has a thirteen-year-old child. Her business is located at a very busy market known as Majengo mpya-Likoni in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attractions not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. She has been selling artwork for the last five years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more artwork to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and open more outlets in future. She describes herself as honest and determined.

loans.use: To buy more artwork to sell

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 32 years old and is married with two children who are 1 and 5 years old.

Fabien has owned a motorcycle since 2005 which he uses for his transportation business. He is very proud of his motorcycle as it allows him to earn money for taking care of his family.

Although Fabien has owned his motorcycle for about five years, his savings are still too low to buy another motorcycle. To solve this problem, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. Added to his savings, this loan will hopefully allow him to buy another motorcycle.

With this second motorcycle, Fabien really hopes that his profits, as well as his savings, will be improved.

loans.use: To buy an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Mane

texts.en: Mane P. is married with one child. Together with her husband, she operates a billiard club, a roomy clean place for this refined sport. The billiard club hosts billiard competitions and has its permanent clientele. The club requires one additional table for its clientele. Mane has applied for this loan to purchase a billiard table.

loans.use: purchasing a billiard table

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., rice, onions, pepper, salt, seasonings, oil, and beans)

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a retail business selling cereals such as maize, beans, and rice. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Caroline faces a major challenge of transportation and passersby. She hopes to open a wholesale business in the future.  

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale

loans.name: Shinechuluun

texts.en:
Shinechuluun, age 37, is a fruit and vegetable vendor. She sells her wares from a stall that she rents at the Kharaa food market, which is the most crowded market in this area because of the cheap prices offered there. She has been running this business for six years and has gained a loyal customer base.

Shinechuluun lives with her husband and their three children in a "ger," which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Their two eldest sons, ages 9 and 17, attend secondary school. The youngest daughter attends a kindergarten.  Shinechuluun’s husband Batdorj, age 37, is a craftsman at a factory that produces double-glazed windows. 

Shinechuluun owns a small family car, which she uses for taking her children to school and to transport her products to and from the market. She is requesting a loan in order to buy some spare parts to repair and service her car. She hopes eventually to have the resources to perform necessary renovations to the family dwelling.

loans.use: To buy spare parts in order to repair and service her car, which is her primary method of transporting her wares to and from market

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El señor Vicente F. tiene 58 años de edad, es oriundo de la ciudad de Ybycuí , esta casado con la señora , Lidia Ventura Oviedo con quien tiene dos hijos.
    Vicente F. se dedica al negocio de la carnicería, lleva trabajando en esta actividad mas de 12 años, en principios en precarias condiciones, actualmente, y con las  ganancias obtenidas pudo ampliar su local, este señor viene operando con la institución desde el año 2005.  
         Hace poco se le descompuso su heladera comercial, motivo por el cual se acerco a la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya  con el fin de solicitar un crédito para poder reparar  esta máquina  fundamental para su negocio  y así  brindarles  a sus clientes  una mayor  comodidad.
texts.en:
Vicente, 58 years old, is from the city of Ybcuí and is married to Lidia, with whom he has 2 children.

Vicente is dedicated to the butcher shop business.  He has been working in this activity for more than 12 years, initially in precarious condition, but now, with his earnings, he has been able to expand his shop.  Vicente has collaborated with this institution since 2005.

Recently his commercial refrigerator broke down, and that is his motive for approaching the Office of the Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation) to solicit a loan to repair his refrigerator which is so fundamental to his business.  This will enable Vicente to offer his customers greater amenities.

loans.use: TO REPAIR THE BROKEN REFRIGERATOR IN HIS BUTCHER SHOP

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Don Eduardo, tiene 44 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa Usulután donde vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 21, 16, 14 y 8 años de edad, posee un taller de estructuras metálicas el cual lo aprendió desde pequeño (niño) por su vecino que se dedicaba a este tipo de taller y el le ayudaba en lo que podia para aprender, el trabaja de lunes a sábado desde hace 35 años .
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de hierro, clavos y véngalas para soldar, estos materiales los está necesitando en el taller pero no cuenta con el dinero para comprarlas por cuenta propia,  pero a través de este préstamo esta incrementado el inventario teniendo la disponibilidad de materiales para realizar cualquier trabajo que le sea solicitado por los clientes.
Sueña con crecimiento tanto para el negocio como para él, crecer como persona en conocimiento de su trabajo y brindar un mejor servicio  a los clientes, así mismo que su familia cuente con estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 44, lives in Jucuapa, Usulután, with his wife and four children who are 21, 16, 14 and 8 years of age.  He has a metal shop.  He learned this skill while still little (a kid) thanks to a neighbor who had this kind of workshop.  He has worked Monday through Saturday for 35 years.

He is asking for a loan to buy iron, nails and soldering tips used to weld.   His shop needs these materials but he does not have money of his own to buy them with.  Through this loan, however, he is increasing inventory and will have the materials on hand for any job his customers might request.

He dreams with growing both personally and in his business, to learn more about his work and provide better customer service.  He also hopes that his family will have economic stability.

loans.use: To buy iron, nails and soldering tips.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo M. is from the village of Victoria, San Mateo. He is 57 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Alfredo owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Alfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Alfredo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Aquiles Francisco

texts.es:
El senor Aqules J., es originario de la ciudad Jinotega, pero para mejorar su nivel y calidad de vida, tuvo que emigrar a Esteli, es Lic. Quimico y Farmacia, tiene 37 anos de edad, soltero, tiene mas de 15 anos de dedicarse al comercio. Proviene de una familia muy humilde, su Padre es Mecanico y su Mama es Ama de casa.
Anteriormente ha tenido oros negocios como: Destace de Cerdos, Vendia ambulante como: posters, llaveros, etc. Incio con ayuda de su Mama.
Poco a Poco fue creciendo y recogiendo un poco de dinero y hace 7 anos que abrio un pequeno establecimiento de venta de zapatos americanos y con la ayuda de sus padres tambien atiende una pequena pulperia.
Es pastor de una iglesia Evangelica "MAHANAIM (Campamento de Dios)".
Realizo este Credito para compra de Inventario de Zapatos.
Su meta es llegar a tener su propia Farmacia y dedicarse a lo que el sabe y lo que el estudio; es decir poner en practica sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Aquiles J. is originally from the town of Jinotega but, in order to improve his standard of living and quality of life, he emigrated to Esteli.  He is 37 years old and has a degree in pharmaceutical science.  Aquiles is single and has been a salesman for more than 15 years.  He is from a very humble family.  His father is a mechanic and his mother is a housewife.

Aquiles has previously owned other businesses such as a pig butchering business and a business selling products such as posters and keychains as an itinerant vendor.  He started his business with his mom's help.

Over time, Aquiles' business grew and he was able to gather together a little money.  Seven years ago he opened his small sales location where he sells American shoes and, with his parents' help, he also serves in a small grocery store.

Aquiles is the pastor of an evangelical church called 'MAHANAIM' (God's Camp).  He requested this loan to buy more shoes to sell.  His goal is to own his own pharmacy and to work in the field in which he has trained.  That is to say, he would like to put his knowledge into practice.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Grecelda

texts.en:
Grecelda B. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Grecelda owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells clothing & shoe products from NATASHA & AVON. She has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. She decided to change her business from making snacks to dealing in ready-to-wear products because she finds it more profitable.

In 2010, Grecelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. Grecelda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts & blouses. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts & blouses

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito – Juli, departamento D. Puno, tiene 55 años D. edad, está casada y tiene con cuatro hijos.  Alejandrina no pudo concluir sus estudios D. primaria. 
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace doce años, su primer crédito fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para comprar zanahoria  y lechuga para incrementar la mercadería D. su negocio, tiene un puesto en el mercado central D. juli donD. ofrece toda clase D. verduras, su esposo se encuentra en el campo dedicándose a la agricultura.
Con éste préstamo D. S/ 600.00 nuevo soles, comprará 4 arrobas D. zanahoria, 6 D. cebolla y 2 cajas D. tomate, dichos productos son comprados en las afueras D. la ciudad.
Su sueño es continuar con la misma actividad y mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el trabajo en equipo.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the "María Asunción Galindo" communal bank which is located in the districto of Juli, province of Chucuito-Juli, in the department of Puno.  She is 55 years old, married and has four children.  Alejandrina was unable to finish her primary education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 12 years.  Her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN was used to buy carrots and lettuce for her central market stall in Juli where she sells all kinds of vegetables.  Her husband is a farmer.

She plans to use the new 600 PEN loan to buy carrots, onions and tomatoes which she must purchase outsiD. the city.

Her dream is to continue her business and improve her earnings.  She enjoys the teamwork present at the communal bank.

loans.use: To buy carrots, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia P. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Lydia is widowed and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as canned goods, junk foods, chocolate & mild drinks in packets, in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products (like canned goods & junk foods) to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods & junk foods.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is a married woman who lives in Cebu, Philippines. She earns her living by operating a general store and a fish vending business.  Her husband Emelio, who is 56 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have five children who are between 19 and 31 years old. Lilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 to buy more stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for future space in the market for her fish vending business. Lilia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old and married with two children aged nine and sixteen, who both attend school. He is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya where he has been practising mixed farming for the last two years. He is currently producing coffee, bananas, paw-paws and eggs, which are all sold to the local market. Robert mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.
Robert has requested a loan of 36,750 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable him to build a decent home for his family. His primary challenges have been pests and diseases, lack of enough water and insufficient funds to pay casual laborers. In future, he would like to acquire three more dairy cows and improve his coffee production to at least 900 kg annually.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en: Munhbat is 41 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His older two daughters and son attend local secondary school while the youngest one is in kindergarten. He manages a vegetable trading business with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1982. They plant their vegetable during spring period and sell them in fall. They own 50 hectare of land and a big storage too. They gained much experience and became well-known amongst their customers. Munhbat is a hardworking man who says, "I am borrowing loan many times from Xacbank. I will do my best to pay back the loan on time." He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT of loan to purchase potatoes and some equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and some equipment.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 45 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. DesD. hace 11 años tiene su granja D. animales, espacio donD. cría cuyes y gallinas, en el que son vendidos, ya sea en el mercado o como también en momentos festivos, que es cuando venD. más D. lo normal. ElL. siempre compra animales para así abastecerse D. capital D. trabajo, además las crías que tiene le da una buena alimentación para así alcanzar un peso exacto para que puedan ser vendidos a un buen precio. En ocasiones sus hijos L. apoyan en el negocio, transportando animales. Este negocio le ha permitido mejorar L. economía D. su hogar por lo que desea ampliar el espacio D. su granja para criar más animales. Es su crédito número 14 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita,  comprará más animales y nuevos galpones D. madera.
texts.en:
Reyna, 45, lives with her two children and her husband in her own house.  For the last 11 years she’s had an animal farm, a space where she raises guinea pigs and chickens, which are sold either in the market or during festive occasions which is when she sells more than normal.  She always buys animals to stock up on working capital.  She feeds the young well so that they will reach an exact weight that will allow them to be sold for good prices.  This business has allowed her to improve her household economy so she wants to expand her farm’s space to raise more animals.

This is loan #14 that she has with MFP and she’s very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she’s always shown herself to be responsible with her payments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

She thanks all those who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy more animals and new wooden sheds.

loans.use: to buy more animals and wooden sheds.

loans.name: Betsabe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Betsabe; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de cds y películas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 3:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de compra y venta de cds y películas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cds y películas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Betsabe is a member of the “ESMERALDA” Communal Bank, which is located in the Cusco district, within the province and department of Cusco.

Betsabe is 26, single, and has 1 son. In addition to her daily activities, she has a door-to-door business buying and selling CDs and movies from 3:00 pm to 10:00 pm. Through this business she has been able to give her son a good start in life. 

She wants to expand and improve her CD and movie business. She requests the loan to purchase wholesale CDs and movies. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments as required.

loans.use: to purchase CDs and movies wholesale.

loans.name: Walter Feliciano

texts.es:
Walter de 41 años, vive con su esposa e hija en casa de sus padres, cuenta con todos los servicios, ubicado en el distrito de Chepén, la misma que pertence al departamento de la Libertad.  La actividad que se desarrolla es la agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace varios años labora como operador de maquinaria en un molino de arroz de la misma zona donde vive,elsalario que recibe es para cubrir las necesidades diarias de su hogar.  Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para realizar unos arreglos en su casa como para cubrir algunos gastos personales.  Con los ingresos que obtenga en el trabajo podrá pagar su crédito y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Walter es un hombre trabajador y con mucha empeño desea que su familia se supere cada vez más y que no le falte nada.
texts.en:
41 year-old Walter lives with his wife and daughter in his parents' home which receives all basic services.  It is located in Chepén district, in La Libertad department.  People in this area work in farming and livestock raising.

Walter has been working as a machinery operator in a rice mill in his area for several years now.  He uses his salary to cover the daily needs of his household.  He has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use part of this money to make some repairs to his home and will use the rest to cover some personal expenses.  Walter will use the income from his job to repay the loan and provide his family with a better quality of life.

Walter is a hard-working and tenacious man.  He wants his family to do well and wants to ensure that they don't want for anything.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his house and to cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan (pictured above), 24, is single. She lives with her father and sister and brothers along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophan is a garment worker. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.name: Maria Alejandrina

texts.en: Maria is a mother of two who lives in Choluteca, Honduras. For the last several years she has made a living by selling basic grains out of her home. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which to buy merchandise. In her free time, Maria enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase cornmeal, flour, beans, rice, and corn.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Glenda has been in this business for 20 years. Glenda earns more income from dried fish vending.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel, 39, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Prudencio, a driver, and they have three children.  She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Liezel oversees operations of their FX Taxi transportation business. They have one unit (10 person capacity) FX taxi, which her husband drives every day in the city. Liezel also sells frozen meat products in order to have an additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 8500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php22, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for maintenance and to buy new accessories and parts for their FX taxi.  Also, she will buy additional frozen products for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Liezel dreams of being able to buy another FX taxi. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for new parts and maintenance of her FX taxi business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is a resident of Litein. He is 23 years old and has been in farming for the last two years producing and selling tea, eggs and milk to the local markets. He currently employs two farmhands on his farm.

Oscar has made a first loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 52,000 KES to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the cow will help him improve his production and expand his farming business with the savings he makes out of the income.

Oscar, though, laments about the animal diseases' costs as well as that of animal feeds. However, he appreciates Juhudi Kilimo’s loan services.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 30 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for the financial and basic needs of her family. 

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the village of San Leonardo Aglipay and requested a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase additional items such as soft drinks, biscuits, candies, ingredients and sugar.

She has been running the sari-sari store for three years. According to her, she is able to earn about PHP 1,000 from her business and she uses this amount for her children's allowances and their daily needs. Marites hopes that she can increase her income through her patience and by using her income to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, candies, ingredients and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: Luis Carlos es casado y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 8 años, ellos viven al suroccidente de la ciudad donde, Luis tiene  un negocio de preparación de alimentos, con el cual genera sus principales ingresos para lograr el bienestar de su hogar. En su negocio vende arroz de pollo, arroz de lisa, arepas, empanadas, deditos, los cuales transporta diariamente en su bici coche para venderlos  de contado a una clientela ubicada en el parque industrial muy cerca de su vivienda. Su sueño es convertir su negocio en una distribuidora de alimentos y también adquirir su propia vivienda. Su mayor desafío es la estrechez del lugar donde convive en familia y simultáneamente desarrolla su proceso productivo. En la actualidad Luis Carlos está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos y realizará adecuaciones a su cocina y a su vehículo, bici coche donde transporta sus productos para la venta. Mientras Luis Carlos trabaja fuertemente por lograr su sueño, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas, no menor del 50%, una rentabilidad sobre los activos de un 39,38%,  indicadores  desde los cuales  proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos la exitosa inversión de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Luis Carlos is married and has two children who are 2 and 8 years old.  They live in the southwest part of the city where Luis has a business preparing meals which is his main source of income for his home’s wellbeing.  He sells chicken with rice, fish with rice, arepas [turnovers], turnovers and fried cheese sticks that he transports daily in his bike/car vehicle to sell them for cash to his clientele located in the industrial park near his house.  His dream is to turn his business into a food distributorship and also to acquire a house of his own.  His greatest challenge is the crowded conditions shared by his family and his business.  

Currently, Luis Carlos is applying for his Kiva loan, the first financing he gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy ingredients to prepare his meals.  He will also do some adjustments to the kitchen and to his vehicle, a bike/car that he uses to transport his products for sale.  While Luis Carlos works hard to reach his goal, he manages a profit margin on sales of no less than 50% and a benefit over total assets ratio of 39.38%, financial indicators from which we can project potential growth and augur a successful investment of his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare his food and do some remodeling in his kitchen and his vehicle.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores lives happily in her hometown of Estefania, Cagayan, together with her husband and five children. Though the family lives less fortunately than some, Dolores still aspires that someday she would lift her family out of poverty. 

With her patience and minimal capital, she established a hog raising business. She had been raising hogs for almost five years. When she sells them to the butchers who came in to their village, she usually earned 2,000 PHP for each hog she was able to dispose of. Profits gained from the business were just enough to cover their daily expenses, especially all her children's needs for daily allowances.

She is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs. With the help of this loan, she would provide enough sustenance and ensure good growth of her hogs.

In the future, Dolores wants to strengthen her hog raising business to save for the college education of her children and for them to have degrees someday, the only legacy she could pass on to them.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is 56 years old, married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she has been running her hog-raising business for more than five years. 

She is requesting loan of 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feed and vaccines. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Marilou enjoys daily activities in her hog raising business. She devotes herself full-time to maintaining her business, which is the only source of income for her family. After taking care of the hogs for four months, she sells them, earning P7,000 (Philippine pesos) per head.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшеду  32 года, он женат, имеет 4 детей. 15 лет он работает в сфере общественного питания. Чамшед мастер своего дела. В этом бизнесе он работает самостоятельно. Чамшед готовит  и продает национальные блюда в столовой. Там у него всегда  чисто и многие клиенты ценят это и хорошо отзываются  о его кухне. Чамшед хочет получить кредит на сумму $3000 США для  пополнения оборота. Получив займ он сможет развить бизнес, что принесет пользу и семейному бюджету.
texts.en: Chamshed is 32 years old, married and has four children.  He has been working in the public food field for 15 years.  Chamshed is a master of his craft and works in this business independently.  Chamshed cooks and sells national dishes at a cafe.  It is always clean there, and many customers value this and give good feedback about his kitchen.  Chamshed wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 to increase his revolving capital.  Having obtained the loan, he would be able to develop his business, which will bring a benefit to the family budget as well.

loans.use: to buy additional dishware and expand business space

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia D. Chucuito y departamento D. Puno, tiene 52 años D. edad, está casada y tiene nueve hijos, todos independientes.
DesD. hace siete años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta D. artículos artesanales y venta D. ovejas, chanchos, pollos y conejos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará chanchos, ovejas cuyes y pollos, diez unidades D. cada uno.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y esposo.
Su deseo es seguir con el negocio, lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas que se les brinda.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the 'Santa Rosa D. Lima' community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito province, in Puno department.  She is 52 years old, married, and has nine children who are all independent.

Andrea has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business selling handicrafts, sheep, pigs, chickens and rabbits. 

Andrea will use this new loan for 1,000 soles to buy pigs, sheep, guinea pigs and chickens (10 units of each).  Her children and husband help her in the business.

Andrea's wish is to continue with her business.  What she likes about her community bank are the meetings and the talks that they give.

loans.use: to buy pigs, sheep, guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Heresvita Aide

texts.es: La. Sra. Heresvita es una persona  trabajadora  y  muy  responsable la  cual  se  dedica  a la  venta  de  ropa  usada y de  esta  manera    a logrado salir adelante  día  con día,  ella  acudió  con  nosotros  ya  que  desea  realizar  la compra  de mercancía  de  la  temporada  de  invierno,  ve  en  el crédito la  posibilidad  de   hacer  crecer   su  negocio  generando   un mayor   numero de ingresos  que  le permitirán  brindar  a  su  familia   una   estabilidad económica, agradece   el  apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de   su  proyecto.
texts.en: Señora Heresvita is a hard-working and very responsible person, who works selling second-hand clothing.  In this way she has been able to move herself ahead in life on a daily basis.  She came to us as she wants to purchase winter clothing.  In this loan, she sees the possibility of growing her business and generating more income.  This will allow her to provide her family with economic stability, thanks to the loan being provided to realize her plan.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for resale.

loans.name: Njolele S.h.g B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Njolele B S.H.G. Group in Western Kenya! Emily is the facilitator of the Njolele B S.H.G. group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Emily takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Emily had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Emily and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Emily will educate her children, ensure food security for her family, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Njolele B S.H.G. group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

In the picture the person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida, de 19 años es una hija responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres en la localidad de Hualahoyo.  Ella tiene 2 pasiones, una es el tejido y la otra sus estudios de Administración de empresas. Ya le falta muy poco para que termine su carrera, lo cual hace posible gracias al tejido de gorras y bolsos, sus clientes le hacen grandes pedidos durante el año. Por lo que agradece a Dios, pues nunca le hace falta trabajo. Además en temporadas de siembra de papa, aprovecha para ganar un dinero extra, porque busca socios para que así pueda ganar dinero. Ahora quiere incursionar en la elaboración de adornos navideños para vender. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Elida, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Elida, 19, is a responsible daughter.  She lives with her parents in Hualahoyo.  She has two passions: knitting and her business administration courses.  She’s very close to finishing her career which is made possible thanks to her knitting caps and purses; her customers place large orders throughout the year.  She thanks God because there’s always work.  In addition, she takes advantage of potato planting season to earn extra money because she looks for members to earn money with.  Now, she wants to go into the Christmas decorations business.

This is the first MFP loan; she is grateful for the support she receives because it will help her make business progress.  She promises to be punctual with her payments because her communal bank is composed of responsible and mutually supportive people.  If Elida were to receive your support, she will use the money to buy natural fertilizers for her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Mirian Gricelda

texts.es:
Mirian Gricelda es una señora que tiene 53 años de edad, casada desde hace 37 años, tiene 3 hijos de 30, 32 y 36 años de edad, vive en la Colonia Sitraterco de Tela, Atlántida.

Doña Mirian vende ropa para damas, zapatos, perfumes, bolsos y carteras desde hace 5 años. También  ella es enfermera y presta sus servicios en el centro de salud de la comunidad. Empezó su negocio  ofreciendo lociones y perfumes a sus compañeros y al ver que los vendía, invirtió dinero comprando ropa, zapatos, cremas, carteras y ya tiene sus clientes allí y en la comunidad. Tiene un familiar en Estados Unidos quien le manda ropa usada para vender. Ella es muy trabajadora, por la mañana trabaja en el Centro de salud y por la tarde se dedica a su negocio.
Con ODEF a obtenido 3 prestamos que han sido para incrementar su negocio, con el préstamo actual va comprar más producto, ropa, lociones y zapatos, ya que es la temporada de navidad y va incrementar sus ventas.
De estas ganancias ella piensa hacerle algunas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mirian Gricelda is a 53 year old woman who has been married for 37 years.  She has three children; ages 30, 32, and 36.  She lives in the Sitraterco de Tela neighborhood in Atlántida.

Mirian has been selling women’s clothes, shoes, perfume, purses, and wallets for five years.  She is also a nurse who works in the community health center.  She started her business buy selling lotions and perfumes to her friends.  Upon seeing that she sold them; she bought clothes, shoes, creams, and wallets.  She already has her customers there and in the community.

She has a relative in the United States who sends her used clothes to sell.  She is very hard-working.  In the morning she works at the health center, and in the afternoon she dedicates herself to her business.

She has had three loans with ODEF, which have been to increase her business.  With the current loan she will buy more products, clothes, lotions, and shoes.  It is the Christmas season, and she is going to increase her sales.  She plans to use this income to make some improvements on her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, lotions, and shoes to stock her business and increase sales.

loans.name: Undurbaatar

texts.en: Undurbaatar is 59 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife is employed, and his daughter is a college student. He started his taxi business in 2005 with his own car. Now that winter has arrived, he needs to maintain his car in order to run his business through a harsh winter. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "It is very hard in winter to run a taxi business. If I maintain it properly, I am very confident that I can run my business." He is requesting 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée.Elle vit avec son mari et leurs quatre enfants.Pour participer à la prise en charge des besoins de sa famille et subvenir à ses propres besoins, elle exerce un commerce de tissus et de produits de beauté.Actuellement, elle sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un pret de 250000f pour acheter 10 rouleaux de tissus.Son ambition est d'acheter une cantine au marché central.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman. She lives with her husband and their four children.

To participate in taking care of the needs of her family and to meet her own needs, she runs a shop selling fabric and beauty products.

At present, she is requesting from the UIMCEC a loan of 250,000f to buy 10 rolls of fabric. Her goal is to buy a canteen at the central market.

loans.use: to buy 10 rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema, 40 years old, is married and has eight children ranging in age from 7 to 23 years old. She describes herself as an honest, determined and jovial woman. She has been selling water to residents in her area for the last five years. Rehema also runs a restaurant to increase her income. Her business challenge is delay in payments from her customers. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy restaurant chairs and tables. In the next five years, Rehema plans to run a hotel in her town.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and tables for a restaurant.

loans.name: Orfilia Regina

texts.en:
Everyone knows me as Dona Orfi, and my little cakes are one of the sweets most sold at my store. I also sell tamales with beans, baleadas (honduran specialty) and sodas. I have had my business for five years and I have been able to earn enough to send my two sons through university. My cakes are famous and people come from other neighborhoods to buy them.

Loan Use: Purchase of cornflour, rice, butter, salt, spices and other items.

Todos me conocen por doña Orfi, y mis pastelitos son uno de las golosinas mas vendidas en mi negocio, tambien vendo tamalitos con frijoles, baleadas, refrescos naturales. Tengo 5 años de tener mi negocio y hasta este momento he logrado graduar a mis dos hijos en la universidad. Mis pastelitos son famosos y otras personas vienen a mi colonia a comprarlos.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, arroz, manteca, sal, especias y otros

loans.name: Tabib

texts.en: Tabib is a Internally Displaced Person, originally from Tartar district of Azerbaijan. He now lives in  Lokbatan. He started his business in 1998. In 2005-2006 he borrowed two times from the Normicro Baku branch - total of $2,200.  He  would like to borrow $1,100 to increase his business more.

loans.use: Increase his trade goods inventory.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is 50 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is blind. Elisa’s husband is a fisherman and works for one of the tourist resorts near their small village. His wages are not enough to support the family, and the income that Elisa brings in from her sewing business is critical to the family finances. Given how important her business is to supporting her family, Elisa want to invest in a new sewing machine. A new machine will increase her productivity and allow her to increase her business income. Her chief goal is always to ensure that her children are provided for and happy.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Arcenia Esperanza

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Arcenia Esperanza, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva y zapato, producto que distribuyo a domicilio y por encargo, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia, soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas mi negocio, tomando en cuenta entre mas producto ofresco mejores son los ingresos.

Hi, my name is Arcenia Esperanza, I have a small business selling new clothes and shoes, taking on orders from clients and delivering the product myself. I have many years of experience in this line of work which has allowed me to generate income for my family’s expenses. I am a single mother of one child. Currently, I need to stock my business, given that the more products I offer the better the income.

loans.use: Compra de Jeans de hombre y de mujer, camisa de hombre, trajecitos de niño y sandalia de mujer// Purchase of men's and women's jeans, men's shirts, boys suits, and women's sandals

loans.name: Gervacio

texts.es:
Señor Gervacio is 38 years old. He is separated from his wife. He has one child named Richard who is 8 years old and goes to school. He lives in the city of Itaugua with his mother and his little boy. He is the only breadwinner in the family.

Señor Gervacio tells us that he has been a mechanic since he was 8 years old. It was out of necessity that he started working at a very young age due to the fact that his family was very poor. He started as an assistant in many of the mechanic shops around the city and travelled to Argentina as well. Thanks to his hard work and dedication, he has been able to open up his own mechanic shop. He would like to give his son the opportunity to go to school and get an education since he was unable to do so due to the lack of money. He would also like to keep his current 4 employees.

He is requesting this loan to purchase more tools such as screwdrivers, a winch, pliers, etc to provide better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gervacio tiene 38 años, es separado y tiene un hijo llamado Richard de 8 años de edad quien va a la escuela, actualmente vive en la Ciudad de Itaugua con su madre y su pequeño hijo, en este momento él es el sosten de ambos Gervacio cuenta que inicio esta actividad teniendo tan solo 8 años, tuvo la necesidad de empezar a trabajar ya que provenia de una familia muy humilde, empezo trbajando como ayudante en varios talleres de la Capital y por motivos de trabajo viajó a la Argentina, actualmente gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicacion logro instalar su propio taller para de esta forma poder brindarle a su hijo una educacion a la que él por falta de recuros económicos no pudo acceder y tambien poder darle trabajo a 4 personas que estan trabajando para él en el taller. Solicita este préstamo para comprar maquinarías y elementos de trabajo como destornilladores, pinzas, torno, etc; y así mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase machinery & other work tools

loans.name: Khaidar

texts.ru:
Khaidar B., 47, is a professional electrician. He is married and has 2 children. Khaidar is electric grid inspector for the town of Yavana. In addition, he raises cattle at home. Khaidar has 20 years of experience raising cattle. He plans to use this loan to purchase 3 bulls. The income from cattle farming supplements the modest pay that Khaidar receives from the town job. Khaidar’s main clients are individuals and businesses that produce meat products and resell them to the local people. Khaidar plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Боев Хайдар, возраст – 47 лет, образование средне-техническое, специальность – электрик, женат, имеет 2 детеей. Работает инспктором в Городской Электрической сети города Явана и параллельно занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота у себя дома. Клиент занимается животноводством в течение 20 лет и имеет хорошие знания по разведению скота. На сумму кредита клиент планирует приобрести 3 бычков, которые он хочет откормить и после чего продать их. Клиент таким образом получает дополнительный доход, так как зарплата получаемая в организации, где он работает не слишком высокая, а также основными его покупателями являются люди, которые приобретая у него скот, затем производят мясные изделия и реализуют местным жителям. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase 3 bulls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an assorted stock of second hand shoes

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en: Anvar B. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the southwestern region of Azerbaijan. He is 50 years old, married and has five children. He rented a food market in Beylagan. Anvar sells sweets, sugar, drinks, and sausages, among other goods, at his market. His son helps him in selling. Anvar needs a loan in the amount of $1,200 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Rabeca

texts.pt:
Rabeca C. is married and has 3 children. She is now entering the program and is asking for a loan of $275.00US for 4 months. She sells new clothes brought from South Africa, and she sells them on foot. She will use the money to invest in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Rabeca C., portadora do BI nº 0016257220 vive maritalmente tem 3 filhos esta a entrar no programa vai tomar o valor de 6000 apagar em 4 meses é negociante vende roupas novas trazidas da Africa do Sul e faz venda ambulante com o valor vai investir no negocio.

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Temur

texts.ru:
Temur Gafur, 35, lives in Varzob district. He is married with one child. Temur has a higher education; he was trained as an architect. He now works at building sites. Aside from this, he also raises poultry. He has a big hen house where he breeds chickens, selling the eggs to wholesalers. This business brings additional income to his family and supplies the markets of Varzob with fresh, home-raised eggs. Temur has been involved in this business for about six years. He is applying for a loan to buy more chickens. He plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Гафуров Тимур проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 35 лет. Женат имеет 1 ребенка. Образование высшее. По специальности архитектор. Работает на стройке строителем по найму. Кроме того занимается птицеводством. Имеет большой курятник где разводит птиц. Продает яица оптовым реализаторам. Данный бизнес дает дополнительный доход его семье и кроме того позволяет обеспечить рынки Варзоба свежими , домашними яицами. Занимается этим видом деятельности около 6 лет.Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы закупить новых курей.Погаситькредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Inocenta's Group

texts.es:
Inocenta, Nancy, and Placida have been members of the Comunal Orcasitas microfinance institution for a year. They live in the Orcasitas community, located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho.

Inocenta is a 47-year-old married mother of two. She has a small general store in her home. She and her husband also make handcrafted tiles.

Nancy is a 30-year-old mother of two. Nancy and her husband make handcrafted tiles as well.

Placida is a 56-year-old mother of 8 children, 6 of whom still live with her. Placida buys and sells tara and cochineal insects. She makes handcrafted tiles as well.

Inocenta, Nancy, and Placida need loans of 1000, 600, and 900 Peruvian soles respectively, which will be invested in paying laborers, and purchasing sugar, rice, noodles, cereal, tara pods, and cochineal insects.

Inocenta, Nancy, and Placida dream of increasing their profits and seeing their children become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Inocenta, Nancy y Placida pertenecen al Banco Comunal Orcasitas, hace 1 año, ellas son D. la comunidad D. Orcasitas, ubicado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Inocenta es casada, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos, Inocenta tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa. Además, Inocenta junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales.

Por otro lado Nancy es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Nancy junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales.

Mientras que Placida es casada, tiene 56 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 6 viven con ella, Placida compra y venD. tara y cochinilla. Además fabrica ladrillos artesanales.

Inocenta, Nancy y Placida necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, cereales, tara, cochinilla y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. Inocenta, Nancy y Placida son incrementar el capital D. sus negocios, que sus hijos sean profesionales y salir adelante en todo.

loans.use: Payment of laborers and purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, cereal, tara pods (a source of tannins) and cochineal insect (used for dyes)

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Janet is a married mother with two children. She has been buying and selling children’s used clothing for the past fifteen years. She buys her products from Accra the capital city of Ghana. Janet says prices of used clothing has gone up and therefore she wants to use her loan to buy more bales of children’s used clothing since it sells faster in the market.

She a member of the group called Royal Priesthood. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama D., 42, widowed mother of 4 children, works very hard with the passion to provide brighter future opportunities for her children. Two of her children are in junior high school and the other two are in primary school. She owns and operates a small grocery in the neighborhood market with items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, gari, groundnuts, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. displayed on top of a table. She also sells piped water to her neighbors who do not have direct access to water.

Ama wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc. to expand her stock. She belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade (Wait upon the Lord) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, evaporated milk, vegetable oil, etc. to expand her inventory

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
Paula is 43 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur. She is married and has 4 children ages 5, 7, 10, and 14. Paula works as a janitor, she has 4 years experience in this work. The money she is requesting will be used to do home improvements and to construct a wall on the Eastern part of her home to improve the security of her family. It has been hard for her to improve the standard of living for her family because her income has not been sufficient to cover expenses, but she hopes to count on the loans from AFODENIC to finish building her home>

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Doña Paula tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 5, 7,10 y 14 años de edad. La Sra. Paula trabaja como conserje, tiene mas de cuatro años de estar laborandoen este oficio, con el dinero que esta solicitando es para mejoras a su vivienda en la construcción de un muro en la parte Este de la vivienda para mejor seguridad de su familia. Le ha costado poder salir adelante con su familia debido a que los ingresos que tienen no son suficientes, pero espera poder contar siempre con los créditos que le otorga AFODENIC para poder terminar de construir su vivienda.

loans.use: To build a side wall for her home

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe has had a store in her house for 6 years. She decided to start this business because she had small children, and she needed to stay at home to care for them. She previously helped her husband with his metalworking business.
